jobs.title: Performance Test Engineer
jobs.content: As a QA Engineer – Performance Specialist, you will be responsible for the creation, maintenance, and execution of performance-related tests.  Scope of responsibility encompasses all systems supporting the E-commerce websites across banners, including internal projects.

jobs.title: Architect
jobs.content:
SeatAdvisor, a proven innovator delivering a smarter ticketing and patron management solution for venues worldwide, is seeking a Software Architect.  If you consider yourself highly motivated, entrepreneurial, hands on, and are interested in working on a platform used by millions to buy tickets for events they care about, we’d love to hear from you.


Your role…



  • Collaborate with engineers, product managers, designers, and customers to design and implement a smarter ticketing platform for performing arts and sports organizations.

  • Clearly distill product requirements and define project boundaries in order to maximize concurrent development

  • Identify and build tools for managing cloud infrastructure, deploying and scaling applications, and ensuring a secure computing environment

  • Research, profile, and optimize platform components to deliver highly available, reliable, scalable, and performant software solutions 


Who we think will be a great fit…



  • You’re willing to have fun, can handle challenging situations with a sense of humor, but more important, you have a passion for being part of an exciting, dynamic company based in beautiful San Diego.

  • Strong written and verbal skills to be able to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical team members

  • Able to balance product, engineering, and overall business requirements to offer solutions that are well thought out and articulate

  • You’re willing to invest in our customers and develop deep empathy for their needs, able to distill insights into the right solution

  • Enjoys mentoring fellow engineers in order to succeed as a team rather just as an individual

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a Software Engineer in DevOps to support and maintain the core components of our financial platform and scale it to serve millions of users across the world. The technical scope of the project is broad and leverages a variety of cutting-edge commercial and open source tools to get the job done.


Responsibilities: 



  • You will help drive all application-level aspects of the company’s SaaS operations

  • You will build, deploy, analyze, troubleshoot and scale the service wherever and whenever

  • You will collaborate closely with Engineering and Data Scientists on all architectural decisions and stay current on nascent technologies to make influential recommendations

  • You will operate very large relational and NoSQL databases, queuing systems, pub-sub servers, and other core infrastructural components

jobs.title: Senior Backend Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a Senior Backend Developer to design and implement core components of our financial platform and scale it to serve millions of users across the world. The technical scope of the project is broad and calls for technical expertise across a wide range of problem domains.


THE ROLE:



  • You will design and implement product features as defined in the roadmap

  • You will own and maintain substantial portions of the backend infrastructure

  • The opportunity to code using cutting-edge platforms and interact with our data science team

  • You will mentor and grow junior engineers on best practices and code efficiency

jobs.title: Senior Software Architect
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a Software Architect to architect and implement core components of our platform and scale it to serve millions of users across the world. The technical scope of the project is broad and calls for technical expertise across a wide range of problem domains.


THE ROLE:



  • You will architect and implement substantial portions of the full-stack infrastructure (both frontend and backend)

  • You will tackle scalability challenges as the infrastructure grows to support increasing user base

  • You will mentor and grow junior engineers on best practices and code efficiency

  • The opportunity to code using cutting-edge platforms and interact with our data science team


QUALIFICATIONS:




    • Technical Leader - you love new technology and always strive for the most fundamentally sound architecture and solution

    • Detailed oriented - you are a proven developer who values clean and efficient code, and always go into the weeds to find the root cause of problems

    • Translator - you have experience working closely with product managers, cross-functional teams, and customers to translate requirements into technical design

    • Solutions Driven - you have experience thinking out loud to create the best solutions to complex, tricky problems, using the latest technical methodologies/processes

    • Craftsmanship - you treat software development as a professional craft and constantly practice your skills

jobs.title: Backend Software Engineer
jobs.content:
SUMMARY 


Itemize is the receipts processing engine for the digital age. This role at Itemize will put you at the forefront of a new and exciting area of commerce and technology. With the most powerful receipt data extraction and management platform – we do it with a 99% accuracy in real time– Itemize is looking for the right person to join the core development team as a software engineer at the heart of the Itemize IP. 


Try out the platform. Download it for free from Apple or Google Play. 


RESPONSIBILITIES 


The software engineer will join the technology team in building the Itemize platform. The engineer will also be responsible for preparing the systems for increases in scale and continuous improvement of the environment. A good candidate will be a team player who will work alongside the different members of the Itemize tech team and will get involved in all of the exciting projects at the company. Writing clean code is a must. Our engineers develop rapidly to keep the code base manageable and adaptable to future needs.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Backend Security
jobs.content:
The Meraki Engineering’s Backend Security Team plays an essential role in protecting Meraki’s customers and products from attacks by building security features and automated tools, finding and fixing vulnerabilities, and contributing a security perspective to other software teams. Acting as the guardians of customer data, we take a proactive approach in protecting our Meraki cloud which controls millions of networking devices and affects millions of client devices and users.


Example Projects of a Meraki Senior Full Stack Security Engineer:



  • Design and build security conscious systems to manage encryption keys and other confidential data.

  • Discover and fix web application vulnerabilities such as XSS and SQLi with code audits, static analysis, and penetration testing.

  • Advise other teams on cloud-oriented security architecture and coding practices.

  • Manage the Meraki Security Rewards Program.

jobs.title: Sr Ruby On Rails Engineer
jobs.content:
What Is Zoomer?


Zoomer is building a new take on food delivery - a platform to handle an extraordinarily high volume of concurrent deliveries from restaurants that already deliver (i.e. pizza, wings, sandwiches, etc.). We’re bringing much needed change to local high-volume delivery restaurants that are still doing delivery the way they’ve always done it. Our restaurants and their customers love the service, and our order volume is surging. You’ll make a real impact working to build and scale Zoomer as we continue to grow to new restaurants and territories.


We have amazing investors behind us, including Y Combinator (S14), First Round Capital, SV Angel, CrunchFund, Eric Ries, Gabriel Weinberg, the founder of DuckDuckGo and others. This is your opportunity to get in on the ground-floor. You’ll have a ton of impact – lots of freedom to evolve our platform, stack, and apps. We follow strong dev practices, put an emphasis on testing, and deploy rapidly.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Zoomer is a venture backed, rapidly growing technology driven startup that provides a platform to connect high volume delivery restaurants with independent delivery drivers. Restaurants leveraging the Zoomer platform are able to provide a better & more consistent delivery experience for their customer, which ultimately leads to a stronger bottom line. Independent drivers on the Zoomer platform have the ability to create their own schedule & increase their own efficiency, resulting in more earnings. Zoomer has made great strides in its quest to reinvent the $36 billion restaurant delivery industry with an aggressive launch schedule still to come. Our platform built to handle an extraordinarily high volume of concurrent deliveries from restaurants that already deliver. We have amazing investors behind us, including Y Combinator (S14), First Round Capital, SV Angel, CrunchFund, Eric Ries, Gabriel Weinberg and others. And we’re just getting started. This is your opportunity to get in on the ground-floor. You’ll have a ton of impact - lots of freedom to evolve our processes, systems, partners, platform, stack and apps. 


Team Overview: DevOps is a small but growing team looking for the right person to help automate as much as possible, in many cases building tools that don't currently exist. Our focus is primarily set on the reliability, security and scalability of our solutions. At Zoomer operations our technology stack and what you’ll be working with will include Ruby (Rails), Redis, AWS, Docker, Terraform, Ansible, PostgreSQL, Nginx, Passenger, and DataDog, PagerDuty among others. However this is an opportunity for the right engineer to get in on the ground floor and play a key role in defining and evolving our architecture, if you have a better way of doing things then we want to talk about it!

jobs.title: 3D Visualizer/ Rock Star
jobs.content:
URBAN ARMOR GEAR (UAG), a leader in the consumer electronic accessories space, is a fast paced, lifestyle driven company that designs, manufactures, and sells rugged, light-weight, accessories for cell phones, tablets and laptop computers. We are looking for a talented 3D Visualizer to join our growing creative team. You’ll be part of an elite group of graphic and industrial designers who develop and market products for UAG’s expanding product offering. The right individual embodies UAG's commitment to producing unique, branded, high quality products.
You will work directly with industrial design, graphic design and marketing to create dynamic photo real renderings for use on packaging, web, print, and a wide variety of promotional materials. We’re looking for an experienced 3D Visualizer with the ability to quickly create amazing product renderings while collaborating respectfully within a team environment.

Visit our website for a look at our current product offering and to see to see some of our 3D images in context:
http://www.urbanarmorgear.com

POSITION SUMMARY:
A UAG 3D Visualizer owns the creation of photo realistic product renderings for all consumer products. This individual works with Design and Marketing to hit deliverables and manage expectations. 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
• Create photo realistic product renderings for packaging, the web, and print collateral
• Work directly with ID, graphics and marketing teams to understand the scope for each project.
• Lead rendering reviews with ID, graphics and marketing team members.
• Manage and organize the image database for easy access and use by all team members.
• Manage and organize rendering assets such as shaders, HDRI environments, backplates and templates.
• Continue to improve the rendering process utilizing the latest software tools, technology and methodologies.

EDUATION, EXPERIENCE, AND SKILLS REQUIRED:
• 3 + years’ experience performing the essential functions of the job.
• Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Design, Product Design, Graphic Design, Photography, illustration or related field, or a minimum of 5 years’ experience performing a role substantially similar to the essential functions of this job description.
• Digital expertise in the use of KeyShot.
• Digital proficiency in the use of Adobe Photoshop for retouching and applying illustrative effects.
• Knowledge of SolidWorks for light 3D CAD modeling and file set up.
• Knowledge of KeyShot VR and animation functionality a plus
• Must be team-oriented, possess a positive attitude, and work respectfully with others.

At UAG, we work hard and play hard. You will be surrounded by a diverse team of talented individuals who share unmatched passion about the work they do every day and the activities they enjoy outside of work. UAG embraces work-life balance so your creativity can flow. To this end we offer a relaxed team environment with no dress code and work-from-home Fridays. Sharing ideas and collaboration is not just encouraged; it’s part of the culture.

We offer one of the most comprehensive compensation and benefit plans in the industry, with extensive health and vision coverage as well as 401K, pension and profit sharing plans.

Inspired individuals should email resume and portfolio samples to jobs@urbanarmorgear.com

jobs.title: C++ Developer
jobs.content:
Integrated Informatics is a consulting company servicing the Energy and Natural Resource sectors. Integrated Informatics offers a positive working environment and a competitive compensation package including benefits. Salary commensurate with experience.



  • Develops in C++ using modern C++ versions and features and Boost

  • Deep knowledge of build configurations MSBuild/CMake/Make/NMake

  • Experience with upgrading compilers for a large code base and third party libraries

  • Experience in improving build times for relatively large code bases

  • Good knowledge of unit test systems and familiarity with MSTest and Boost unit test

  • Refactoring experience, in particular for unit tests to allow for parallel processing

  • Experience in or exposure to continuous integration for build automation

  • Experience with using version control systems such as TFS and git

  • Ability to Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve build issues

  • Preference towards candidates with Python experience

  • Exposure to Microsoft toolchain and C#.NET development

  • Able to work effectively on Windows environments

  • Understanding of Agile development processes

jobs.title: Software Developer, Tools and Integrations Salesforce
jobs.content: As we evolve our business and bring new products to market, customer insights and access to data becomes paramount. As the first fully technical member of the Partner Operations team, you’ll serve as the tech leader to elegantly integrate our systems. You’ll collaborate with internal stakeholders in Sales, Marketing, Operations, and Engineering to solve complex business problems with technical solutions. You’ll help to enrich our CRM with value-add data that informs our sales process. You’ll serve as the team's Salesforce developer to ensure our marketing automation platform is fueled with insights and data to power nurturing campaigns and maximize conversion.

jobs.title: Automation Tester
jobs.content:
Reporting to the Test Team Lead in our Leeds City Centre Office, the Automation Tester will be responsible for delivering high quality, robust automated test scripts. Working within a Scrum Team and from a backlog, you will analyse manual test scripts and then design, write, execute and report on automated tests. All to ensure an amazing experience for Jet2.com and Jet2Holidays customers.

Working closely with the Test Team Lead and the wider Test Team you will assist in management of the automation backlog, ensuring stories are automatable. Following sprint planning you will write high quality and robust Web UI automation scripts which will be added to the existing test suite. You will ensure that automated tests run automatically to schedule, results are reported and that defects are triaged. Continuous improvement is key to the role and it is expected that you will feed into technical standards and ways to continually improve the automation suite. This role will require you to think in a logical manner, solving problems and employing a methodical approach to your work with excellent attention to detail.

To be successful in this role you must possess experience as an Automation Tester or in a similar QA position and have proven experience of using test automation, test management and defect tracking tools. Knowledge of SQL and scripting languages/programming is essential. Experience of writing API tests in an automation framework. E.G: SOAPUI is desired. The preferred candidate will have experience of using XML, C#, EggPlant although this is not essential.

In return, we offer an excellent salary and benefits package with fantastic opportunities for progression in a growing business.

This is a great opportunity to be part of an exciting forward thinking business. We operate scheduled leisure flights to holiday destinations in the Mediterranean, the Canary Islands and to European Leisure Cities from our 9 UK bases.

Help us to send our all-important customers on holiday with Jet2.com and Jet2holidays!!

jobs.title: BI Developer (T-SQL, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS)
jobs.content:
Reporting to the Business Intelligence (BI) Manager, you will work as part of an agile BI Development Team delivering high quality, innovative BI solutions to all areas of the business using the full Microsoft BI technology stack.

You should have proven experience using all components of the Microsoft BI technology stack including strong T-SQL skills, SSIS, SSAS and SSRS. Previous experience working on medium to large scale BI solutions would be an advantage as would knowledge of Master Data Services (MDS) and Data Quality Services (DQS).

You will be passionate about both technology and data and be able to work to tight deadlines as part of a larger team. You will also be capable of working closely with non-technical business users to ensure solutions are delivered on time and to requirement.

Any experience of statistical data modelling, data visualisation, data mining or database administration (particularly in relation to BI) would be beneficial.

In return, we offer an excellent salary and benefits package with fantastic opportunities for progression in a growing business.

This is a great opportunity to be part of an exciting forward thinking business. We operate scheduled leisure flights to holiday destinations in the Mediterranean, the Canary Islands and to European Leisure Cities from our 9 UK bases.

Help us to send our all-important customers on holiday with Jet2.com and Jet2holidays!!

jobs.title: BI Developer (Tableau)
jobs.content:
Reporting to the Business Intelligence (BI) Manager, you will work as part of an agile BI Development Team delivering high quality, innovative BI solutions to all areas of the business.

Tableau has been adopted as a key component of our BI platform and we are looking for a BI Developer with experience using Tableau (**Desktop and Server**) to work with business users to deliver compelling, informative and actionable data visualisations based on trusted data sources as well as providing analytical capability to support business teams in getting the most out of their data through the use of Tableau.

You should have a good understanding of data visualisation best practice and design techniques and be able to demonstrate how to present complex information in simple, innovative and effective ways using Tableau. You should be able to demonstrate knowledge of the following Tableau functionality:

  • Actions
  • Navigation
  • Dashboard Design
  • Data Blending
  • Calculations (including Level of Details)

You should be familiar with the construction of Tableau Data Sources and will be responsible for ensuring consistency across approved Tableau data sources and ensuring data source documentation is maintained and standardised.

Experience with data modelling techniques and the Microsoft SQL Server BI technology stack would be an advantage (**T-SQL, SSIS**) as would knowledge statistical data analysis techniques.

You will be passionate about both technology and data and be able to work to tight deadlines as part of a larger team. You will also be capable of working closely with non-technical business users to ensure solutions are delivered on time and to requirement.

In return, we offer an excellent salary and benefits package with fantastic opportunities for progression in a growing business.

This is a great opportunity to be part of an exciting forward thinking business. We operate scheduled leisure flights to holiday destinations in the Mediterranean, the Canary Islands and to European Leisure Cities from our 9 UK bases.

Help us to send our all-important customers on holiday with Jet2.com and Jet2holidays!!

jobs.title: IT Project Manager
jobs.content:
Reporting to the General Manager √± IT Project Office, the IT Project Manager will work closely with key stakeholders and the Project Team members to manage IT Projects, or IT elements within larger projects through the full lifecycle to time, cost and quality.

In this exciting new role you will manage projects through the full lifecycle (e.g. Initiation, Requirements, Business Case, Design, Build, Test & Live) and document/manage as living documents the project plan, issues, actions risks and dependencies. There can be approximately 20 projects running at any one time and the role holder could have responsibility for 5 to 10 different sized projects that are in progress concurrently. While managing these projects you will work closely with the following business areas; Finance and Compliance, HR, Airline Engineering, Airline Operations, Customer Services and Infrastructure and Telephony to name a few. In addition, you will facilitate, host or run (as appropriate) workshops or presentations relevant to the progression of the project while maintaining constant communication with Stakeholders and Management to report on project progression.

To be successful in this role you will have significant IT project Management experience with a Prince 2 practitioner or other appropriate Project Management accreditation, you will have demonstrable experience of managing projects which incorporate changes across multiple platforms, business areas or systems. You will have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with strong stakeholder management experience; ideally you will have worked with agile methodologies previously and have an understanding of ITIL environments.

In return, we offer an excellent salary and benefits package with fantastic opportunities for progression in a growing business.

This is a great opportunity to be part of an exciting forward thinking business. We operate scheduled leisure flights to holiday destinations in the Mediterranean, the Canary Islands and to European Leisure Cities from our 9 UK bases.

Help us to send our all-important customers on holiday with Jet2.com and Jet2holidays!!

jobs.title: Software Development Manager (.NET)
jobs.content:
Reporting to the General Manager - Business Intelligence (BI), the IT Systems Manager will work closely with business teams across the Company to understand and document requirements associated with significant business problems and opportunities.

You will be responsible for ensuring the Development Team follow the development and release processes and be involved in further improving the processes to ensure we support the business in developing high quality solutions. You will be managing the Development Team, whilst facilitating daily scrums, retrospectives and sprint planning. In addition, you will manage velocity and team commitment, estimate and plan with senior team members and remove and escalate impediments. The Technology stacks we use at Jet2.com and Jet2holidays are .NET / Web Applications / SQL Server.

The successful candidate will have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with proven stakeholder management skills and the ability to build and maintain fantastic working relationships with 3rd party suppliers and colleagues at all levels. You will be experienced in the management of software development projects and have knowledge of both Agile and waterfall software development methodologies. You will be a pro-active self-starter who will use their initiative to solve problems and evolve internal processes and have the ability to motivate and encourage collaboration amongst Project Team members. A good understanding and experience of the full project lifecycle is required.

In return, we offer an excellent salary and benefits package with fantastic opportunities for progression in a growing business.

This is a great opportunity to be part of an exciting forward thinking business. We operate scheduled leisure flights to holiday destinations in the Mediterranean, the Canary Islands and to European Leisure Cities from our 9 UK bases.

Help us to send our all-important customers on holiday with Jet2.com and Jet2holidays!!

jobs.title: Support Analyst (T-SQL)
jobs.content:
Reporting to the Quality Assurance (QA) Systems Manager, the Support Analyst will work closely with the Support and Development Teams to provide support and development on our in-house applications.

This is a hands-on role where you will be investigating issues raised by users, resolving or escalating in a timely manner where appropriate. You will take ownership of any incidents raised through to completion.

This is a vital position, supporting the largest e-commerce platforms in the North.

The successful candidate will have strong T-SQL skills, have experience of using an issue log system to record and track IT problems or queries raised by users. You will also have proven experience of providing IT Support within a fast moving environment working to tight timescales. You will ideally have knowledge of web related technologies, be ITIL Foundation certified and have experience of C# development in a Visual Studio Team System environment.

In return, we offer an excellent salary and benefits package with fantastic opportunities for progression in a growing business.

This is a great opportunity to be part of an exciting forward thinking business. We operate scheduled leisure flights to holiday destinations in the Mediterranean, the Canary Islands and to European Leisure Cities from our 9 UK bases.

Help us to send our all-important customers on holiday with Jet2.com and Jet2holidays!!

jobs.title: Test Analyst
jobs.content:
Reporting to the Test Team Lead in our Leeds City Centre Office, the Tester will be responsible for working within a scrum team of Developers and Testers to ensure the timely delivery of high quality projects. This is a very hands-on role to test in-house applications by analysing user stories, designing, writing and updating test cases and test scripts all with a view to providing an amazing experience for Jet2.com and Jet2holidays customers.

Jet2.com is a leading leisure airline operating a fleet of B737-800s & 300s and B757-200s flying from 9 UK airport bases: Leeds Bradford, London Stansted, Manchester, Newcastle, Belfast International, Edinburgh, East Midlands, Glasgow and Birmingham. Jet2holidays is an ATOL-bonded tour operator with ABTA membership which offers great value package holidays to city and sun destinations across Europe and beyond from our 9 UK airport bases.

Technology underpins all the success we've had at Jet2.com and Jet2holidays, whether it's our Mobile apps, Mobile Site and desktop eCommerce platform that handles over ¬£1.2b of Revenue, or our innovative BI solutions that provides real time insights across the entire business. We've been recognised for our work, winning 'Best Internet Booking System' and 'Best Package Tour Operator' at the Northern Ireland Travel and Tourism Awards in 2015. Very recently, Jet2.com was voted as the UK's best airline by TripAdvisor users of its airlines review service.

Working closely with Developers and Testers within scrum teams, you will be responsible for timely and accurate completion of manual testing. This includes regression, system integration, exploratory testing, completing defect reports and verifying any fixed issues that are complete. This role will require you to think in a logical manner, solving problems and employing a methodical approach to your work with excellent attention to detail.

To be successful in this role you must possess experience as a Tester or in a similar QA position and have proven experience of using test management and defect tracking tools. Knowledge of web related technologies is essential. The preferred candidate will have experience of using Visual Studio and Microsoft Test Manager although this is not essential.

In return, we offer an excellent salary and benefits package with fantastic opportunities for progression in a growing business.

This is a great opportunity to be part of an exciting forward thinking business. We operate scheduled leisure flights to holiday destinations in the Mediterranean, the Canary Islands and to European Leisure Cities from our 9 UK bases.

Help us to send our all-important customers on holiday with Jet2.com and Jet2holidays!!

jobs.title: Lead Database Administrator - SQL Server
jobs.content:
Why Apply?
Is it important for you be excited and engaged by the work you do? Do you want to work in a company where your great ideas are executed? Is it essential for you to contribute and impact the business? Where you can learn and grow?


Total Wine and More, winner of Wine Enthusiast’s 2014 Retailer of the year, is building on its leadership position to drive innovation and brand differentiation through technology investment. The Total Wine and More Information Technology team is growing and we are driving business value through technology across all aspects of our business. You will leverage your experience with SQL Server to participate in all aspects of the design, development, implementation, and support of a database at the heart of a Windows-based enterprise application with opportunities to play a leading role in the design of a data warehouse solution. This position works closely with both the Business and IT teams to maintain and improve SQL production and development environments.

• Collaborate with development teams on designs that require an efficient and effective integration of database services into custom software solutions

jobs.title: HRIS Analyst Workday

jobs.title: Server Administrator
jobs.content:
Position Summary:


The Infrastructure Engineer at Inmar is tasked with ensuring the delivery of technical services for new and existing clients.  The candidate will be a part of a team supporting the hosted environment for our client applications and provide preventative support, integration and infrastructure automation initiatives.  This role will require strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, experience in integrating multiple technology platforms and brands of products, solid communication skills and tackle the complex problems of automation and scale which are unique to our company.


This position requires a service-oriented mentality, a high sense of ownership of the problems and requests assigned, a focus on managing and resolving issues in alignment with the SLAs, establishing and maintaining communication with technology customers to keep them updated with status of their requests, initiating and performing changes on production systems and proactively escalating any issues that cannot be resolved within the established timeframes.


Major Responsibilities/Essential Functions:



  • Management, maintenance and architecture of virtualized and non-virtualized infrastructure, not limited to servers, storage and productivity tools

  • Proactively manage systems and identify performance issues proactively

  • Develop, support and maintain the automation of infrastructure and the “infrastructure as a service” effort

  • Interfacing with multiple teams such as Network Engineering, Security, Database Services, Devops and Application Development in their infrastructure and automation needs

  • Active role in planning future infrastructure architecture and automation features

  • Documentation and communicating all infrastructure changes

  • Participation in 24X7 on call rotation

jobs.title: Senior System Administrator
jobs.content:
We're looking for an experienced systems engineer to help us scale our infrastructure for Postmark, Beanstalk, and DeployBot.  It's a big role to fill and requires broad knowledge of software and infrastructure. You'll have direct impact on how we define and build our systems. We consider performance and service availability a primary feature of every product we offer. Your work will ensure that tens of thousands of developers can successfully build on top of our services with confidence and peace of mind. 

Your role on the team

We run a fully managed environment of bare metal hardware and virtualized servers hosted in one of the most advanced data centers in the midwest (with ServerCentral). Our infrastructure is made up of a variety of server configurations (mostly Supermicro and Juniper), including all SSD storage and 10GbE networking.

You will help design and maintain the infrastructure for our products. This includes capacity planning of hardware and network as well as building the infrastructure to bring up new services. This might range from designing faster ways to provision servers to improving shared services like monitoring, logging, DNS, and IPAM. 

Our application developers are heavily involved in running and understanding the systems that our products are built upon. You will work directly with the team to help automate, provision, and scale the services that support our customers. 

For example, we are currently expanding to new data centers. You would help define how we automate provisioning across each data center while keeping network, security, monitoring and services consistent. This expansion is critical to lowering latency and increasing availability for our customers.

As part of the systems team you will be responsible for:

  • Infrastructure design decisions from network, to hardware, to data center vendors. 
  • Improving the automation framework that allows us to provision new services for our products. 
  • Working with the team to automate services and infrastructure (Ansible).
  • Interacting with hardware and data center vendors directly on purchasing decisions for increasing capacity.
  • Coordinating maintenance or updates between developers and operations.
  • Coordinating with data center on new servers or networking changes.
  • Emergency incident response and diagnosis of system outages or alerts.
  • Writing and updating internal documentation of systems and processes.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years in an operations role
  • Ability to maintain common applications such as nginx, memcached, MySQL, DHCP, NTP, SSH, DNS.
  • Some experience managing Windows servers (Postmark run on C#)
  • Familiar with network design for larger scale projects (IPAM, VLANS). 
  • Ability to drive architectural design decisions, solve technical problems, and make improvements to our processes.
  • Comfortable with database administration (we use MySQL, Elasticsearch, and Redis)
  • Ability to define physical server specs (but not building them).
  • Extensive knowledge of the Linux operating system.
  • Experience working on critical, highly available web applications and APIs (redundancy, load balancing, automation).
  • Familiar with automation tools such as Ansible.

Bonus points:

  • Experience with ZFS
  • Understanding of SMTP and Postfix

Benefits:

  • Full health benefits
  • Company-paid retreats
  • Computer of your choice, renewed every 2 years
  • 25 paid days off per year
  • Quarterly profit sharing
  • Attend conferences
  • Quiet Fridays
  • 40 hour work week with flexible hours

To apply: First, meet the team and learn more about us at http://wildbit.com. We've had a remote culture since we started in 2000 and it is a core part of the company. Our team always comes first, so it's important that our values match. If you think it is good fit, please apply at https://wildbit.workable.com/jobs/253343/candidates/new. We're looking forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Front-end Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As engineers, we extract and present biological data efficiently and reliably. Our other team members include biologists, who run cell experiments in a wet lab, and data scientists, who build descriptive models from experimental data.

We're looking for strong front-end engineers. We use Angular.js, React, pure JavaScript when we don't need a framework, and on the back-end Go and Python. Our services are deployed on a myriad of cloud services from AWS and GCE.

You'll:



  • Write responsive, clean front-ends for tools for biologists, using pure JavaScript+CSS+HTML, and know when to use a framework

  • Turn "it'd be nice if I could X" into an implementable design

  • Design interfaces for large amounts of data that may load slowly (think high-resolution cellular images and charts packed to the brim)

  • Design interfaces for humans on the move, not necessarily at their computers (for example, for biologists using tablets and a 2D bar-code scanner to deal with inventory)

  • Design for different types of browsers and tablets

  • Prototype interfaces quickly and without needing to hook-up a backend

  • Interact with various back-end sources, such as REST APIs and raw database connections


If you've got a knack for coding and would like to apply it to a meaningful purpose, let us know -- you don't need a biology background.

We offer competitive compensation and our hiring process is fast.

jobs.title: Front end Developer
jobs.content:
Teacup Analytics is looking for a front-end developer.


We’re removing the noise from Google Analytics data to provide the simplest, most insightful analytics experience for small businesses and web professionals.


It starts with their website. Built on top of Google Analytics, Teacup qualitatively grades traffic channels, segment by segment, landing page by landing page. So we know which channels are marvelous and which landing pages really work. But this is just the beginning.


The good bits:


You’ll be one of the first full-time employees at Teacup (we went live in March 2016), so there’s plenty of room to add your charm and direction to the company.


Eventually, you’ll be working with a great team to compliment your strengths. As the team grows, your role will too, if that’s what you want.


Work from anywhere - there’s no office, so you can work where you feel happiest.


The challenging bits:


As our first dedicated front-end developer, you’ll be in charge of the web UI. This means bridging our awesome designs and sophisticated backend functionality to produce a simple, beautiful and reliable user experience.


In addition, you will be responsible for the architecture of the front-end code, both existing and new. Prepare to dive in and start a combination of new feature build and continuous optimisation of existing code. Your passion for a great user experience will be called on.


As a modern startup, we aim to have complete test coverage. However, our existing front-end code has been in too much flux due to rapid feature build to justify this. We are now moving into a more stable development phase, so you’ll be expected to write tests for all new code, and existing untested code over time.


Because we work with skilled designers, you do not need to be a graphic design expert. However, you will need to be able to work with existing and new HTML and CSS from our designer, and produce some of your own.


The basic bits:


This is a full time role.


Competitive compensation with payment in dollars.

We're seeking New York-based candidates only. Ideally, the designer will be able to work in Sydell’s office in New York three days per week, but we are open to flexible work arrangements. jobs.title: Interactive News Developer
jobs.content:
The Interactive News desk at The New York Times is looking for creative, interdisciplinary thinkers with strong technical backgrounds.

About Us

Interactive News is the special digital projects team embedded within the newsroom of The New York Times. You‚Äôll be working with editors, reporters, photographers, designers and other developers to create newsroom-facing tools and reader-facing projects that expand the horizons of our digital news report.

Our department‚Äôs goal is to practice web development and software engineering as a newsroom craft. We draw on technical expertise to imagine new editorial forms. Most of our work is published in collaboration with other newsroom departments. Your role is to bring digital creativity and software expertise. Interactive News handles a mix of project types:

Early-stage experiments: You will iterate quickly and collaboratively to explore new ideas. More mature projects: You will use engineering expertise to improve the scale and repeatability of our projects. Library and tool development: You will package functionality so that it can be reused by others in the organization. About You

No journalism experience is required, but you should enjoy thinking about how to create thoughtful experiences for our readers.

You also have a strong sense of personal responsibility: You can be trusted to deliver. You take a creative approach to solving problems. You have a strong technical skillset: You can take ownership of a high-quality digital experience from start to finish. You enjoy working as part of a team but are self-disciplined when working alone. You‚Äôre comfortable jumping between details and bigger-picture challenges. If you are a member of a group that has been historically underrepresented in technology, we especially encourage you to apply. About our Tech

Ruby, Node and Python are the team‚Äôs predominant backend technologies. On the frontend, our projects are largely JavaScript (ES5+) and CSS (often SASS), with judicious use of ReactJS and similar project-appropriate libraries. Deployment, testing and maintenance of projects are shared responsibilities. We currently deploy server-side code in Docker containers to a Kubernetes cluster. You should have demonstrated experience in one of the areas above and be willing to build skills in the rest. We have both backend-focused and frontend-focused roles available. From either perspective, you ideally would be comfortable working (or eager to learn to work) across the stack. In Interactive News, we want every team member to be comfortable making changes and pushing them live to the site.

Apply!

Please provide:

Links to some work samples, e.g. sites you‚Äôve worked on, your Github, or a portfolio site Your r√©sum√© A brief paragraph describing why you‚Äôre interested in the job and what you hope to get out of it

jobs.title: Event Design Industrial Engineer - CNC Router Technician
jobs.content:
Our firm is an award-winning event décor company located in Chicago, creating inspirational experiences for our clients throughout the country for over 20 years. We value exquisite designs, impeccable style, innovative ideas and sublime aesthetics, and we treasure creative team members who embody these same ideals. Do you believe in endless possibilities? Do you have a passion for events? If so, our company is for you.

We are seeking a talented industrial designer and CNC router technician to design new inventory, and supervise, plan, and direct router production to execute innovative designs. This is a unique opportunity to shine and collaborate with other creative team members company-wide to develop new design and décor ideas.

Some key responsibilities include:
• Producing router-based, custom build event designs for production and translating designs into production work.
• Establishing production schedules and managing production on the CNC Router.
• Creating renderings for design projects.
• Working with the graphics team to ensure file prep is correct.
• Managing the CNC shop including: supervising staff, establishing pricing guidelines, and managing inventory.
• Creating renderings for design projects.

Are most successful designers/technicians are able to handle competing demands with ease, manage deadlines, work independently, manage pricing and budgets, and delegate work flow effectively.

The ideal candidate has the following:
• A college degree in industrial design, architecture or theatre (specifically BA or BFA) (or comparable work experience) is preferred. Prior router technology/production experience is required.
• Working knowledge of vector-based 2D graphics software (including Illustrator, InDesign, AutoCAD or equivalent)
• Must be adept at working with Solidworks. Working knowledge of PETC and printer equipment. Working knowledge of 3D modeling software (including Rhino, 3D Studio Max, or equivalent)
• Working knowledge of router toolpathing and operating software (Enroute, or equivalent).

Experience in one or several of these areas are preferred as well:
• Carpentry skills and experience with woodworking.
• Experience with finishing and rigging of theatre scenery.
• Experience with basic metalworking and welding equipment.
• Experience with sculpting and painting techniques.

We expect our ideal person to be in the shop and office during the business day from Monday through Friday and be available at additional times as needed.

jobs.title: Junior Bug Detective - QA in a New Way
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Our Quality Assurance team ensures that our website can continue to evolve while maintaining reliability and quality and makes sure that new features are in the best possible shape before they go live. Now we are looking for a detail-focused individual who can assist us in speeding up our testing speed without compromising our high standards. Working as part of a multidisciplinary Scrum team, you will test new features to guarantee that they are functioning correctly and that they integrate problem free into our existing products. You will get the chance to learn how to properly create and develop automated tests as you collaborate with our Software Engineering team. You will identify bugs using automated, exploratory and regression testing, as well as by performing data analysis using business intelligence tools. You will be responsible for making sure that your area is great shape, allowing features to be smoothly and punctually released. In some cases, when unforeseen problems arise, delays will be inevitable, so it is essential that you inform all relevant stakeholders of potential roadblocks so that overly optimistic expectations don’t lead to disappointment.

jobs.title: Hadoop / Big Data Specialist  Hive / Oozie / Impala
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

We like to move fast and work on a large scale. We’re looking for a Hadoop Hero who has experience building Hadoop clusters from scratch to keep our cluster in perfect shape and save us from getting crushed under the weight of big data. You will maintain and develop our Cloudera Hadoop cluster, set up a backup cluster and keep them in sync. You will also consult with our Business Intelligence team regarding the setting up and maintenance of reliable data pipelines. With your hawk-like vision, you’ll monitor our Cloudera CDH installation, fine tuning it to maximize performance. Lightning-quick reflexes and agility will also be required as you may get caught in Nerf gun wars that rage across the office.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Core Hotel Data
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

trivago is looking for Software Engineers who are passionate about their craft, versatile and ambitious to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward!
We offer an international, results-driven, fun and dynamic environment. If scale and complexity excite you, trivago should be your first choice!

Our engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users search for their ideal hotel at the best rate. Our ambitions reach far beyond just searching for hotels. Our product needs to handle information at the scale of the web. We’re looking for ideas from a lot of different areas of computer science, including information retrieval, data processing, data storage, distributed computing, large-scale system design and many more; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a Software Engineer, you work on a small team and on many different projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves.
You will be a leader in the design, implementation and ownership of major modules and sub-systems. With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, maintain and enhance software solutions.


Your responsibilities:



  • Build and maintain our Core Hotel Matching infrastructure.

  • Play a leading role in designing and implement new functionality and platform enhancements as needed.

  • Work closely together with members/stakeholders from other teams (BI, Product, etc.).

  • Be creative, challenge yourself and spread the word: contribute to one of our lovely open source projects.

jobs.title: Junior Data Integration Specialist
jobs.content:
Join trivago and help shape the future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Apply today and work with the latest technology and with colleagues from over 60 countries.

From the images we display to descriptions of hotels, locations, ratings and more, trivago aims to ensure that all hotel-related content on our site is accurate and high-quality. Now we're looking for a data-minded individual who can manage our content imports and have a significant impact on how we approach content integration.



What you'll do:



  • Coordinate with our Sales team and Content Account Managers to set up and manage content imports from advertisers and other external sources.

  • Manipulate data sets to match trivago's existing data schema.

  • Monitor data imports and investigate potential issues by thoroughly reviewing data sets.

  • Make sure that automated data imports are running correctly.

  • Collaborate with our Software Engineering team to develop new tools and features and ensure that our content implementation system is first-rate and meets our ever-evolving business requirements.

jobs.title: Software QA Engineer - Leipzig Office
jobs.content:
Join trivago and help shape the future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Apply today and work with the latest technology and with colleagues from over 60 countries.


Can you make sure that trivago's QA processes are world class and drive the quality of our products to the next level through rigorous testing? If you can help ensure that our products remain user-centric, our Leipzig office has the position for you.



What you'll do:



  • Conduct pre- and post-release tests of trivago's websites on numerous devices (tablets, iPhone, Android phones etc.). Evaluate usability, functionality and design, detect bugs, develop test guidelines and create test scenarios and user stories.

  • Design and implement automatization measures for continuous regression testing.

  • Take an active role in product development discussions, assess whether application changes are releasable, provide feedback to developers and take responsibility for quality assurance at trivago.

  • Suggest processes that will improve the quality of trivago's products and help us to lead the way in QA.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - DevOps / Platform- Engineering
jobs.content:
Join trivago and help shape the future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Apply today and work with the latest technology and with colleagues from over 60 countries.

Want the opportunity to actively shape the technical future of trivago? Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!


What you'll do:



  • Build, setup and automate immutable infrastructure with configuration management tools like Saltstack to ensure trivago's speed is not impacted with its growth.

  • Consult the team on how to build a reliable, fault-tolerant and immutable infrastructure and application design based on best practices.

  • With heavy growth comes new technical requirements. Research new ideas and build prototypes using Vagrant or Saltstack for example.

  • Design, build and maintain custom toolsets when the necessary tool is not on the market.

  • Work hand in hand with other teams and departments in order to make your work more productive.

  • As an expert in your area, you will be expected to share your knowledge and impart your wisdom with the rest of the us by documenting processes and consulting team members.

jobs.title: Web Test Automation Framework Architect
jobs.content:
Testing a rapidly evolving product with thousands of lines of code that are altered almost daily is a bit of a challenge. Ensuring the quality of web applications in a big-data environment with constant A/B testing, a huge range of supported browsers and various mobile devices can seem like mission impossible. Still sounds like fun to you? Then this could be your dream-job!
Help shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technology in a company that promises a unique work environment and fantastic career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question the status quo, to broaden your horizon and to develop new things!


Your responsibilities:



  • You are responsible for designing, maintaining and improving our testing framework.

  • You support our teams in high-quality tests implementation (code reviews, architecture consultancy on proven principles and best practices).

  • You monitor test results and help to detect and fix flaky tests.

  • You define test strategies and analyse results of the executed tests.

  • You push our software development cycles to the next level with your innovative solutions for quality assurance and automated testing.

  • You work in cross-functionally with teams across Product Development.

  • You analyse our needs and come up with new solutions to increase productivity.

jobs.title: Software Engineer for SEO  PHP
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Join our dynamic Software Engineer department as a PHP Developer with a strong SEO focus and help shape the future of the world’s largest hotel search.


Your responsibilities:



  • Build and improve our high traffic web applications for our millions of daily users.

  • Evaluate and estimate the implications of SEO strategies on our technology stack.

  • You support and advise the marketing and product departments with your unique technical insights.

  • Actively question established approaches and raise the level of innovation to stay ahead of competitors in a fiercely contested market.

  • Code reusable, clean, and easily testable software in a huge environment of challenging complexity.

  • Use your creativity and proficiency to make a difference within your team and beyond.

  • Work in a cross-functional team with passionate experts from various fields.



The ideal candidate:



  • Has at least 2-3 years’ experience in PHP/JavaScript development, ideally in a SEO-driven environment.

  • Holds an academic degree in the field of IT or has relevant experience developing large applications.

  • Stays up to date with current tools, libraries and standards (e.g. Google Tools, W3C, ARIA, IETF, HTTP, HTML 5).

  • Has knowledge about accessibility for humans and robots alike.

  • Is passionate about the semantic web and has excellent knowledge of structured data.

  • Always takes the impact of website performance into consideration.

  • Has a solid understanding of software construction.

  • Naturally follows good development practices like test automation, CI/CD, source version control.

  • Enjoys technical challenges and is eager to explore new technologies. An understanding of search engines and their importance in markets worldwide would be a plus.

  • Feels comfortable communicating in English on a daily basis.

  • Can start as soon as possible.


Life at trivago is...



  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • Being an active member of our PHP, JavaScript, and UI guilds.
    The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hoursbased on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

  • Working at our head office in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highest quality of life in the world for expats.

jobs.title: Design and Marketing Intern / Associate
jobs.content:
When it comes to creative licensing, brand management and representing leaders in Art, Fashion and Design Brands, we're kind of a big deal, but we need some sharp, confident go-getters to help us grow and become even better.

We are an international brand licensing and consulting company that helps manufacturers and marketers become greater and do more by providing high caliber content for products and promotional campaigns. We are currently seeking a dynamic, creative, organized recent college graduate or current student for a full- or part-time paid internship / associate position. Must be highly self-motivated, passionate, and eager to assist in all facets of creative and sales growth. We want and need people who like to wear many hats, and do so ambitiously.

The ideal candidate has excellent design, social media, brand strategy and research skills.

Here's what you'll be doing:
• developing marketing materials, customer pitches and brand decks using InDesign and Photoshop
• designing product mock-ups for customer specific pitches
• designing and coordinating social media (Instagram, Twitter, Facebook), email marketing (MailChimp) and website design (Squarespace)
• creating and modifying images and documents using InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator, as well as Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
• working with our sales team in researching new business opportunities and generating leads
• processing and organizing digital assets and archives
• photographing, sorting, archiving, packing and shipping product samples
• performing general office duties (handling correspondence and packages, answering phones, scanning documents, filing, etc)

Experience in design and marketing required. Interest in art, fashion, product development and/or sales helpful. *knowledge of Xcode is an extra plus.
Excellent experience and growth potential for the right person.

jobs.title: Packaging Designer
jobs.content:
TITLE: Packaging Designer
DEPARTMENT: Design & Engineering
REPORTS TO: Industrial Design Manager
FLSA: Exempt

Job Summary

The Packaging Designer is responsible for creative, motivated structural packaging designs that can support our Design and Development teams. This includes the creation of packaging for a diverse range of products from soft goods to hard goods, for US and International markets. This is a key position with lots of responsibility, from initial ideation and comps to final dyelines.

Duties and Responsibilities

• Researches competitive packaging for each category and project as needed
• Develops innovative structural designs that are on-brand, cost effective, structurally sound and ready for mass production
• Responsible for schedule development and executing on-time
• Responsible for die-line creation and material specification
• Prototypes and presents work to internal teams for approvals throughout the development process
• Creates packaging samples/prototypes for evaluation and sales/marketing tools
• Works with brands and licenses to ensure packaging meet brand guidelines
• Be able to mock up final art and packaging for presentations and production
• Work closely with Graphic Design team to determine artwork and messaging layout
• Responsible for creating thorough, easy-to-follow packing instructions for vendors
• Responsible for reviewing vendor samples and commenting as needed
• Maintains library of existing packaging and materials
• Evaluates current departmental procedures through independent judgment and offers a recommendation for change to their immediate supervisor
• Create and present packaging concepts based on client/project parameters

Minimum Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in Packaging, Industrial Design, or related fields required
• 2-4 years of work experience in structural packaging specialty
• Solid skills in Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office. 3D CAD skills in Rhino or
SolidWorks
• Knowledge of materials, including papers, boards, plastics and finishes
• Knowledge of printing/manufacturing/assembly process
• Ability to take initiative and prioritize tasks--good time-management, organizational and problem-solving skills
• Creative, with strong 3D geometric and problem-solving abilities

Physical Demands and Work Environment

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions.
While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands or finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, and the ability to adjust focus.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

jobs.title: Senior Manager, Industrial Design & Human Factors - Medical Devices
jobs.content:
The Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices organization is seeking a multi-faceted, exceptionally talented, user-centered Senior Manager, Industrial Design & Human Factors (IDHF) who is passionate about improving the quality of people's lives through compelling design experiences. This position will be located within our Medical Devices campus in Raynham, MA.

With worldwide sales of over $27 billion, Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices is one of the world’s largest, most innovative surgical companies. The businesses represented in the J&J Medical Device sector are Acclarent, Advanced Sterilization Products, Biosense Webster, DePuySynthes, Ethicon, Mentor, and Sterilmed.

The Senior Manager, IDHF will embrace the various roles this position requires consisting of Usability Champion, Research-driven Innovator, Classic Industrial Designer, Brand Ambassador, Strategic Design Leader, and People Manager:

- Embrace human-centered design methodologies to identify what makes a product intuitive-to-use. Observe and interact within a clinical environment to identify and eliminate potential use errors early in the development process. Leverage insights to inspire others to think more empathically.
- Provide creative design leadership that uncovers new product opportunities. Work with the IDHF team and our customers to gather, synthesize and translate user research into device concepts that advance surgical care.
- Possess a strong understanding of "how things work" with an innate interest in materials and process. Ability to visualize and create concepts that meet cost targets, project schedule, manufacturing processes and hospital procedures. Collaborate and evolve existing visual brand language, as well as contribute to future design strategies.
- Collaborate across J&J to help build a compelling and unique brand presence in our market. Apply creativity to help influence a brand that fuses great product design with customer experience aspirations.
- Optimize IDHF's ability to execute great design within a complex healthcare environment. Ability to make decisions affecting resources (people, cost, and time), possess broad project management skills, and the ability to adjust between big picture thinking and product level details.
- Active contribution to the Global Medical Devices IDHF leadership team on strategic planning, organization design, and implementation approaches across multiple global locations.
- Management responsibility for organizational structure and professional development of ID|HF associates. Ensure associates have the resources, information, training and support to meet their objectives in a timely, competent and cost effective manner

Qualifications
- A BS/BA in Industrial Design, Human Factors, or related degree with a minimum of 10 years of relevant professional experience is required.
- The successful candidate must possess excellent visual communication skills using traditional sketching and digital media is required.
- Relevant experience leading multi-disciplinary product development teams and external partners is required.
- Self-directed activities focusing on development of product line strategies, planning flexible department structures & supporting change as corporate structure evolves. Able to achieve a balance of daily departmental operation & individual work load is required.
- Demonstrated ability to effectively recruit, develop, manage and coach associates to strengthen organizational capabilities around product design is required
- Experience with department administration, including operating within expense & capital budgets is required.
- Experience with the design and development of healthcare products, regulated industry, surgical procedures/experiences, and knowledge of hospital environments are preferred.
- Additional skills and hands-on experiences that augment the design process (e.g., Human Factors Engineering, Cognitive Psychology, Graphic Design, Information Design, Interaction Design, Mechanical Engineering, Clinical Experience…etc.) is preferred.
- This position may require 15% travel and will be located in Raynham, MA.

jobs.title: Principal Industrial Designer
jobs.content:
The Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Industrial Design and Human Factors team is seeking a multi-faceted, exceptionally talented, user-centered Principal Industrial Designer who is passionate about improving the quality of people's lives through compelling design experiences. This position will be located within our Medical Devices campus at Irvine, California

With worldwide sales of over $27 billion, Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices is one of the world’s largest, most innovative surgical companies. The businesses represented in the J&J Medical Device sector are Acclarent, Advanced Sterilization Products, Biosense Webster, DePuySynthes, Ethicon, Mentor, and Sterilmed.

The role of Principal Industrial Designer will join the West Coast section of the JnJ IDHF team to partner with internal and external stakeholders, and lead Industrial Design and Usability activities on projects across four diverse business platforms based in Irvine CA, (Acclarent, Advanced Sterilization Products, Biosense Webster, Mentor). Collaboration across the greater JnJ IDHF team will also be part of the role, helping shape best practices in usability and design.

The Principal Industrial Designer will embrace the various roles this position requires consisting of Design Leader, User Centered Research Champion, Classic Industrial Designer, and Strategic Partner:
+ Providing input into the planning and execution of product development programs - ensuring there is time and resources for the appropriate design activities.
+ Collaborating with internal and external partners to plan and execute user research in real and simulated environments - reviewing and synthesizing data to uncover new opportunities and unmet needs, identify potential use errors and develop solutions to mitigate safety risks.
+ Using traditional sketching, digital tools, CAD models, and physical mock-ups to communicate unique ideas and product concepts - sharing ideas with various audiences and leveraging skills of collaboration and influence to drive alignment behind the best solution.
+ Deploying design thinking methodologies to help our business partners visualize abstract concepts and leverage IDHF's position in the organization to shape the future of our business.

Qualifications
+ BS/BA in Industrial Design or related design degree with a minimum of 10 years of relevant professional experience is required.
+ The successful candidate must possess excellent visual communication skills using traditional and current sketching and digital technology (Photoshop, Illustrator, PowerPoint, etc or similar) Proficiency using CAD tools (Alias, SolidWorks, etc or similar) to create 3D databases that capture design intent and are suitable for downstream applications are required.
+ Relevant experience working with design for manufacturing in multi-disciplinary product development teams and external partners is required.
+ Experience with medical device development and regulated landscape and familiarity with Usability Engineering processes is preferred.
+ Experience with the design and development of physical products and/or capital equipment and systems is preferred.
+ Additional skills and hands-on experiences that augment the design process is preferred (e.g., Human Factors Engineering, Cognitive Psychology, Graphic Design, Information Design, Interaction Design, Mechanical Engineering, Clinical Experience…etc.)
+ This position may require
For consideration, please submit a PDF, or provide link to web-based, portfolio that demonstrates successful products, an established creative process and proficiency with design and prototyping methodologies.

jobs.title: Senior Industrial Designer
jobs.content:
The Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices organization is is recruiting for a Senior Industrial Designer who is passionate about improving the quality of people's lives through compelling design experiences. This position will be located within our Medical Devices campus in Raynham, MA.

With worldwide sales of over $27 billion, Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices is one of the world’s largest, most innovative surgical companies. The businesses represented in the J&J Medical Device sector are Acclarent, Advanced Sterilization Products, Biosense Webster, DePuySynthes, Ethicon, Mentor, and Sterilmed.

DePuy Synthes is a Johnson & Johnson company that is one of the leaders in the medical device industry. Our implants and instruments are used by orthopaedic surgeons to treat patients with conditions resulting from traumatic injuries, degenerative diseases, deformities, and sports related injuries. Our environment is entrepreneurial, learning-driven, and is as challenging as it is rewarding.

DePuy Synthes Companies of Johnson & Johnson is the largest, most innovative and comprehensive orthopaedic and neurological business in the world. DePuy Synthes Companies will offer an unparalleled breadth and depth of products, services and programs in the areas of joint reconstruction, trauma, spine, sports medicine, neurological, craniomaxillofacial, power tools and biomaterials. Building on the legacy and strengths of two great companies, we are creating one organization that will be agile and better equipped in today's evolving health care environment. With a focus on activating insights to develop innovative, comprehensive solutions, we are inspired to advance patient care in greater ways than either company could accomplish on its own.

DePuy Synthes Mitek Sports Medicine offers innovative solutions in sports medicine for the treatment of soft tissue injuries.

The mission of the Industrial Design & Human Factors (IDHF) group is to create compelling user experiences that are intuitive, holistic and branded. Using human-centered innovation, Design Thinking methodologies, and brand-driven design strategies we aim to create a portfolio of surgical tools that are as sophisticated and precise as the procedures they perform.

The Senior Industrial Designer will be diverse in their thinking, capabilities and experiences embodying the following attributes necessary for success:

Human Factors/ Usability Champion. Use human-centered design methodologies to identify what makes the product intuitive-to-use. Gain insights from observing highly skilled ‘Key Opinion Leaders’ as well as complete novices as they interact with existing products, sketch models, and prototypes. Identify and eliminate potential use errors early in the development process.

Research-driven Innovator. Provide creative design leadership that uncovers new product opportunities. Work face-to-face with our customers, gather, synthesize and convert user research into purposefully innovative concepts that differentiate DePuy Synthes in the market.

Classic Industrial Designer. Possess a strong mechanical aptitude with an innate interest in materials and process. Use traditional sketching and CAD tools to create concepts that meet cost targets, project schedule, manufacturing processes and hospital procedures. Collaborate to evolve established visual brand language and contribute to future design strategies.

Brand Ambassador. Collaborate across the DePuy Synthes Franchise and J&J to help build a compelling and unique brand presence in our market. Apply your creativity to help create a brand that fuses great product design with customer aspirations.

Strategic Design Planner. Optimize IDHF's ability to execute great design within a complex environment. You must possess broad project management skills and the ability to seamlessly switch between big picture thinking and product-level details.

Qualifications
+ To be considered for the role a minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Design or equivalent required.
+ At least four years of experience applying user-centered design principles and branding throughout the product development process is required.
+ Creative capacity to conceptualize designs, develop and identify alternative solutions to problems must be demonstrated, along with the ability to communicate using 2D visualization, 3D CAD modeling and presentation skills.
+ Proficient time management, project planning and tracking skills are critical.
+ Experience identifying user needs and requirements through user research, observing people using products is preferred for this role.
+ Experience with the regulated industry is required. especially an understanding of medical device usability standards, is preferred.

For consideration, please submit PDF or provide link to web-based portfolio of sample work.

This position is located in Raynham, MA and may require up to 10% travel including international.

BE VITAL in your career, Be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.
