jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
Hornet is the fastest growing gay social network in the world. We are a mobile location-based discovery app with social features unseen in the competition. We connect 15 Million users worldwide and are growing rapidly. 

We pride ourselves in having a reliable tech platform for guys to discover each other and connect, 24/7/365. We're looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to help us uphold this reputation into the future as we build out new product enhancements and features. A unique opportunity to engineer large scale systems that power an app people use every day.

What you'll do:

  • Develop tools, processes and provision environments to enable backend engineers to deploy and monitor their own systems.
  • Build and battle-test high availability infrastructure with a particular focus on Mean Time To Repair (MTTR)
  • Be involved with the software design process to provide insight and expertise for building reliable and scalable software infrastructure from the ground up.
  • Partake in an on-call rotation alongside the engineers who build our production backends.

What you'll need to have:

  • Comfort with large scale production systems and technologies, for example load balancing, monitoring, distributed systems, and configuration management.
  • A track record of designing and executing medium to large scale systems automation projects with strong autonomy.
  • Strong coding skills in at least one programming language, and a desire to pick up more. We work primarily in Ruby, with smatterings of Go and Node.js

Deep knowledge of the following platforms/tech highly preferred: 

  • Amazon Web Services (especially EC2, S3, etc.)
  • PostgreSQL
  • Cassandra
  • Linux (Red Hat / CentOS)

To apply: Send us a brief resume/CV at careers@gethornet.com, along with a brief introduction and why you think you'd be a great fit for this position.

jobs.title: Software Engineer for 3D Mapping & Visualisation
jobs.content:
Can you help us to collect and visualise terabytes of Geo data using cloud technology? Are you looking for an attractive career in an international company? Then Fugro is looking for you.


Fugro operates worldwide to perform measurements with advanced sensors to map the earth’s surface and subsurface. Day in, day out we collect terabytes of data. We do this to provide geo-intelligence and asset integrity solutions to our clients. Our software engineers help in the development of these sensors and write software to process and analyse the data. They also take care of the presentation of the data in our web based 3D virtual world. 


Within our team, software engineers have a varied set of responsibilities. You will analyse the specifications for new development and you will research how these can be implemented within Fugro’s software. You will take care of the implementation, using open source libraries and modern platforms such as C#.NET, MVC and WebGL. All our data has a spatial component, so you will be using GIS, CAD and visualisation software as well. We rely heavily on cloud services (AWS) to enable scalable software and high performance computing, so as a software engineer you will be working with these cloud resources extensively.

jobs.title: Senior Algorithm Developer for Autonomous Driving
jobs.content:
SOME IT WORKS. SOME CHANGES WHAT'S POSSIBLE.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR DYNAMIC DEVELOPMENT PROCESSES.


If it's good enough, we make it better. To be included in a BMW, every element has to be first-class. The best way to guarantee this is to start with ideal conditions and an outstanding team of specialists. Are you ready to overcome every obstacle, to turn exceptional ideas into reality and to set new benchmarks? We're ready too, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Senior Algorithm Developer for Autonomous Driving (m/f)
Job reference: 105395


We are offering you an interesting position at the BMW Group to work as a Senior Algorithm Developer (m/f) in the field of Autonomous Driving. Your tasks will include the development of algorithms and software solutions for the environmental and driver model. In close cooperation with the specialist departments, you will develop the architecture of highly networked, innovative software. Here, you will be involved in the entire development chain, from requirements analysis, algorithm design, implementation and validation of the software, through to integration of the software on the control devices. In your position, you will write and optimize complex algorithms, such as for the recognition, classification and fusing (high and low level) of objects and open spaces fit for driving and of situation interpretation, and you will provide support in implementing the algorithms into efficient embedded software. Your thrilling range of activities will be rounded off by the testing and validation of the developed algorithms, as well as testing and functionality throughout the overall vehicle.

jobs.title: Software Test Engineer
jobs.content:
RUNNING AN APP IS GREAT.  RUNNING A CAR ON ONE IS GENIUS.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR DYNAMIC DEVELOPMENT PROCESSES.


If it's good enough, we make it better. To be included in a BMW, every element has to be first-class. The best way to guarantee this is to start with ideal conditions and an outstanding team of specialists. Are you ready to overcome every obstacle, to turn exceptional ideas into reality and to set new benchmarks? We're ready too, so our team in Ulm is currently seeking a:


Software Test Engineer (m/f)
Job-reference: 107201


We are offering you an interesting position as a Software Test Engineer (m/f) in an international team at BMW Car IT, which acts as a company-internal vendor of software, cooperating closely with other departments responsible for designing and building automotive software components. You will work together with your scrum team to understand the features and their technical implications. You will identify use cases and create automated test cases on different levels (module, subsystem, system) with focus on system integration testing. Your work will take you through test planning, designing and developing test cases and test automation frameworks like xUnit and GoogleTest. Furthermore you will be responsible for making automated tests run. You will also analyze test failure causes and support development teams debugging the problems. In your role as a Software Test Engineer (m/f) you will support development teams in designing their software components for testability. Additionally you will work together with those development teams in creating tests, providing mocks and failure analysis tools which requires both your technical as well as communicational skills. Special attention is given to test automation, where you are responsible for test design, test execution, analysis of test results, defect analysis and reporting. Your range of tasks will be rounded off by the continuous improvement and optimization of test tools and processes.

jobs.title: Java Lead Engineer
jobs.content:
EVEN IN ELECTRONICS, YOU CAN GO AGAINST THE CURRENT.
SHARE YOUR PASSION IN A TEAM OF FREE THINKERS.


More than 90% of automotive innovations are based on electronics and software. That's why creative freedom and lateral thinking are so important in the pursuit of truly new solutions. Naturally, that includes flexible working models, so that our IT specialists are free to go in unconventional directions. We want to keep pushing the limits of what's possible, so our team in Ulm is currently seeking a:


Java Lead Engineer (m/w)
Job Reference: 98074


We are offering you an interesting position in an international team at BMW Car IT, which acts as a company-internal vendor of software, cooperating closely with other departments responsible for designing and building automotive software components. We are looking for an experienced Java/Java EE engineer (m/f) to help us to establish a company-wide continuous integration (CI) service based on Jenkins. You will be part of an international team of highly talented software engineers at our site in Ulm, Germany. Together you will drive innovation and improvements in BMW"s software engineering practices. Your main tasks and responsibilities include improving and extending the existing code base, driven by customers’ requirements. You will discuss and guide architectural issues within the development team. Additionally, you work closely with customers to find the best possible CI process. You are also responsible for analyzing and improving performance and scalability of the CI system.

jobs.title: Senior QA engineer
jobs.content:
As a Senior Quality Assurance Engineer (f/m) you will play a major role supporting our development team and help us create a fabulous E-commerce platform with cutting edge 3D customization tools.


Join a creative, smart, self-motivated, and experienced group of people at a successful company where your input will make a real difference. We offer a competitive compensation package, flexible working times, and great opportunity for advancement and long-term career building. We invest in the personal development of our people and provide high-end equipment for their work.


We work in short cycles in order to adapt our software continuously to our business needs. We like to use the newest available technologies and mainly use open source solutions when it comes to development. We work in small, agile teams using methodologies such as SCRUM, Kanban, pair programming, TDD/BDD and continuous integration/deployment. Your ideas are always welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better. Besides a dynamic, highly motivated international team, you will find minimal hierarchies, quick decision-making and a pleasant working atmosphere.


Your tasks



  • Design and implement efficient and reusable testing software

  • Decompose high-level business requirements into test scenarios

  • Own, setup and maintain automated test environments and workflows (protractor / Sauce Labs)

  • Identify and address performance issues

  • Work with our developer and marketing team to analyze features/requirements and determine appropriate test coverage

  • Manually testing bugs after dev and eventually record the test to use it later automatically

  • Help run a batch of manual test before deployment

  • Have a customer-focused understanding of the website. From that, assuring the most essential site functions are always operable.

  • Communicate daily with colleagues from all departments about apparent issues on the site. Be ready to explain how the site works, when the issue is not a bug.

  • Periodically review correspondence with onsite support (Chat). Glean site issues or improvements from those customers.

  • Assure that site has a consistent UI on all supported browsers and operating systems.

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
• Improve the daily lives of hundreds of thousands of grocery shoppers

  • Go where nobody has gone and get wide recognition for a world class web store

  • Design, create, own and maintain our high-performance cloud-based eco-system (Java stack)

  • Innovate, design and implement elements like the online store, order management, inventory and warehouse management, transportation planning and many more

  • Push your limits in creating super clean, well structured, testable, performant, high quality code and application tests

  • Keep up with the latest technologies and define our future technology stack

  • Be challenged every day again by our extremely talented team

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
U.S. News & World Report is seeking an experienced Software Developer with an interest in building dynamic, data-driven products to join a growing developer team at one of the world’s most trusted brands. For 80 years, U.S. News & World Report has built a strong and profitable business by providing research and ratings that help individuals and families make important life decisions. While the platform has evolved, what hasn’t changed is our commitment to providing our readers with the highest quality products.


The developers at U.S. News have a great deal of independence and minimum overhead.  You will have the opportunity to experiment with interesting technology and see your work enter the Production environment regularly.


The key skills we are looking for in a new hire include excellent problem solving abilities, interest in Full Stack development using Python and Django, and knowledge in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Ability to write legible code, and strong oral and written communication skills are a plus.


Our diverse technical environment includes Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X machines operating side-by-side.  The majority of our work involves application development on Python web frameworks, specifically Django.


Developers typically see applications through from beginning to end, working directly with project owners to create, implement, upgrade, optimize, and test features and projects.


We offer a casual work environment.  Our offices are in the Georgetown neighborhood of Washington, D.C.


If you are passionate about working on a team dedicated to building the best products and user experience, then we would love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Software Dev/Tech Lead
jobs.content:
U.S. News & World Report is looking for a full stack Software Developer / Technical Lead with an interest in building dynamic, data-driven products to join a growing developer team for one of the globe’s most trusted brands.  For 80 years, U.S. News & World Report has built a strong and profitable business by providing research and ratings that help individuals and families make important life decisions.  While the platform has evolved, what hasn’t changed is our commitment to providing our readers with the highest quality products.


The developers at U.S. News have a great deal of independence and a minimum of overhead. This individual will get to experiment with interesting technology and see their work enter production regularly.


The key things we’re looking for in a new hire are excellent problem solving abilities as well as the technical skills to work with relational databases such as PostgreSQL, write legible code, familiarity with languages such as Python or Java, and strong oral and written communication skills.


We have a diverse environment, with Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X machines living side-by-side.  The majority of our work is in developing and maintaining applications on Python web frameworks, specifically Pylons and Pyramid, although we also maintain some applications in Java and PHP.


Our applications support just about every aspect of company operations, including content management for the usnews.comwebsite, iPad/tablet apps, data ranking products such as Best Colleges/Grad schools and Best Hospitals, and other business applications.  Developers typically see applications through from beginning to end, working directly with project owners to gather business requirements, front-end engineers to make sure the UI is functional and fast, and the systems team to ensure stress-free deployments.


We offer a casual work environment.  Our offices are in the Georgetown neighborhood of Washington, D.C.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
U.S. News & World Report is looking for a junior/mid-level, front-end developer with significant full-stack ability to join our growing developer team building data-driven products for one of the globe’s most trusted brands.  For 80 years, U.S. News & World Report has built a strong and profitable business by providing research and ratings that help individuals and families make important life decisions.  While the platform has evolved, what hasn’t changed is our commitment to providing our readers with the highest quality products.


This position requires expert knowledge of front-end development and web standards as well as comfort working with backend technologies.  The successful candidate will become an influential member of a passionate and friendly team that creates web applications that reach millions of visitors monthly.


Duties include:



  • Working with editors, web producers, graphic artists, and programmers to create innovative online features and interactive tools.

  • Developing web-based applications, components, and visualizations from conceptual page plans in Photoshop.

  • Crafting flexible templates for custom Python and Java-based applications.

  • Integrating and troubleshooting code from third-party content and e-commerce partners.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Thrive Bioscience is building the machines that make stem cells. As scientists get closer to using stem cells in humans, there is an ever increasing need to automate the process of making, modifying and growing stem cells. Thrive's mission is to deliver that automation.


Thrive's instruments involve robotics, image processing, fluid handling, refrigeration / heating and centrifugation. These are complicated devices that manipulate living cells.


Thrive's founders, management and board each have decades of experience building and growing successful, technologically innovative companies. We work with world-class scientists at leading institutions to develop the instruments and software they need to push their research forward.


We are looking for an experienced embedded software developer to join our engineering team. You will be part of a team that is integrating a wide range of technologies including robotics, distributed processing, user interface, fluidics, environmental control, microscopy, machine learning and image processing to develop an expanding family of instruments.

jobs.title: Customer Happiness Specialist
jobs.content:
Love making people feel happy? Love connecting with our customers, readers, and fans? Then this could be the job for you.

As our Customer Happiness Specialist, you√¢¬Ä¬ôre the essence of extraordinary customer service. You go beyond answering emails, beyond responding to comments on Facebook or Twitter, beyond managing customer accounts. You truly touch people√¢¬Ä¬ôs lives. You are the heart of our reputation, and ensure feedback flows to all teams in order to improve and innovate our services and student experience.

If you think you are smart, action-oriented, analytical, love creative ideas, and have a passion for marketing and learning new things, we welcome you to apply!

Responsibilities
  • Provide an amazing, personalized experience to each customer. No copy and paste answers. Only meaningful, personalized replies with love and care injected into each message.
  • Effectively diagnose and solve day-to-day customer concerns and issues through various support channels such as emails, calls, blogs, social media etc.
  • Analyze customer feedback while continuously looking for ways to improve customer experience.
  • Engage the customer community through our forums, social media platforms, and daily interaction.
  • Inspire and motivate our students to work towards their goals and achieve success.
  • Strive to make Lurn nation a community that our students are proud to be a part of
 
Experience and Skills
  • Excellent command of the English language.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Enjoy spending hours communicating with customers.
  • Technology is your good friend.
  • You can communicate technically with NON-technical people.
  • You have an innovative mind and are a self-starter.
  • Proactive in coming up with ideas and solutions that will improve customer experience.

To apply: To apply, please send us a copy of your resume as well as a video cover letter explaining why you are a good fit for this position. Your video cover letter should be no longer than 2 minutes.Please use this link to apply: http://lurn.com/career/customerhappinessspecialist.html

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Your responsibilities



  • Manage, maintain and improve Hybrid cloud environment and the application it hosts

  • Assist Partners in utilizing the platform

  • Provide Technical expertise and architectural know-how

  • Strive to deliver the best possible experience for the units utilizing the platform

  • Assess relevance of new technologies


We offer



  • A dynamic and motivated multilingual working environment strongly focus on teamwork

  • An opportunity to test new technologies, drive PoCs and implement new technologies if they prove relevant

  • A chance to touch a wide variety of up to date technologies, following up to date practices

jobs.title: Unix Systems Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are seeking to recruit an enthusiastic, highly motivated software engineer to work at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) located at the Wellcome Genome Campus near Cambridge in the UK.

You will be working in the Software Infrastructure Services team maintaining and improving in-house software systems. Work will include:



  • Maintenance and development of our existing user account management system

  • Maintenance and development of a petabyte-scale file archiving solution

  • Development of new systems infrastructure software tools as required.


Software Infrastructure Services is part of the Systems Infrastructure team, whose responsibilities include HPC, storage, datacentre infrastructure and networking. You will work alongside systems administrators and software engineers providing services to internal and external users.

jobs.title: Backend Software Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a talented python software engineer to join the the Open Targets Core team. You will be involved in running large-scale biological data analysis and integration and developing the REST API powering the targetvalidation.org platform.

The main responsibilities will involve design and implementation of backend micro-services and data processing pipelines in Python on Unix-based systems, and maintenance of those services in a cloud environment.



In addition the post will involve extensive interaction with web developers and UX team to refine and test the interface to the services.

You will join a startup-like environment, where we use a range of modern technologies and we continuously look for improvement. We work following Agile practices and you are encouraged to take ownership of what you work on.

The Centre for Therapeutic Target Validation (CTTV) is a recently established public-private initiative between EMBL-EBI, GlaxoSmithKline and the Sanger Institute, to generate and integrate evidence on the validity of biological targets for drug development. The core CTTV operations are based at the EMBL-EBI.

jobs.title: Java UI Engineer
jobs.content: Redwood Software is growing, and we are seeking a Java UI Engineer for our Morrisville, NC office. You will be part of a small high-performing team of developers helping us build our industry leading document management application.  You will be working mainly on UI focussed tasks using JSPs, JavaScript and JQuery.  You will also get involved with back end tasks from time-to-time which is all in Java, therefore back-end Java experience would be beneficial for us. This role will allow you to partner with our product management team to define, design and implement new functionality across our Report2Web application.  You will deliver high quality code and features with a high degree of ownership and work with other team members to define the Report2Web product and make it great!

jobs.title: Senior Java Software Engineer
jobs.content: Redwood Software is growing, and we are seeking a Senior Java Software Engineer for our Morrisville, NC office. You will be part of a small high-performing team of developers helping us build our industry leading document management application.  You will be working on back-end heavy tasks using Java, and you will also get involved with database work as well as occasional UI functionality.  This role will allow you to partner with our product management team to define, design and implement new functionality across our Report2Web application.  You will deliver high quality code and features with a high degree of ownership and work with other team members to define the Report2Web product and make it great!

jobs.title: Mid-Level Software Tester
jobs.content:
As a Software Tester at Keylane, you are responsible for the design and execution of test plans. You are also actively involved in the analysis of test results and the reporting thereof. With your clear approach and critical eye you make a difference when it comes to the quality of our software.


Some specific tasks: 



  • Maintain and execute functional, usability and regression tests.

  • Create test cases and test scenarios independently.

  • Execute and monitor testing.

  • Reporting of test results to team members.

  • Taking an active role in creating new test environments and to improve testing methodology and techniques.


The Keylane test teams are growing and developing rapidly, which is why you can take on a dynamic role within the organisation. Brainstorming about innovation and implementing new and improved methods and techniques is what the current business is all about!

jobs.title: Java Developer
jobs.content:
As an experienced Java engineer within Keylane you’ll manage your own projects and budget. Within a close-knit team of developers, functional designers and testers you’ll carry out the big and complex changes to our software solution. The account teams will manage the specs with the clients and our project support handles administration, so you can focus on your programming.


Specific tasks for a Java engineer:



  • Devising technical and logical program designs.

  • Programming in Java, JSP and HTML/JavaScript/CSS.

  • Designing and implementing database queries using SQL.

  • Optimising the system for performance and capacity.

  • Optimising the functionalities of the database.

  • Implementing unit and system tests.

  • Organising and attending technical design sessions and code reviews.

  • Holding regular meetings with your team, functional designers and the client, respectively.

  • Implementing deployments


Besides working on Java development, we offer a range of courses to work on your own development. We also like to share our knowledge with colleagues, so you can start your own course within the organisation or use your skills to educate junior developers.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, C++
jobs.content:
We're looking for talented engineers to develop innovative, robust, and solid software for many aspects of our remote presence products. You will focus on turning customer and business needs into product functionality, creating the infrastructure necessary to operate our company, and making the entire engineering team more effective.



Roles and Responsibilities



  • Design and build key components of our client apps (Windows, Mac, Chrome, iOS, Android), server software, and networking infrastructure

  • Develop and iterate prototypes of new product concepts and technical solutions

  • Build and improve internal engineering productivity tools

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Performance
jobs.content:
We're looking for senior level engineers to develop innovative, robust, and solid software for many aspects of our smart presence products. We are seeking a seasoned systems performance software engineer with the passion and experience necessary to design, develop, and support Beam technology.



Roles and Responsibilities



  • Design, build, and deploy our core web service infrastructure

  • Main work will be in the design and implementation of overhead, scalability, stability, and stress tests using industry standard tools and custom developed software written in Python and Django.

  • Ownership of significant areas of the code for both new feature/functionality development as well as to maintain/redesign of the existing areas of the product

  • Develop new features, and test coverage, based on product needs and opportunities for technical innovation

  • Provide accurate scoping, clear strategies, and milestones for performance tests

  • Provide expertise for use in patches, research projects, sizing, capacity planning, and hardware and network configuration

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
Technical Support Specialist
jobs.content:
As Looklet is constantly growing, we are now looking for a competent, driven and service-oriented colleague to join our Technical Support team!


Are you known as the one most tech savvy person among your friends? Are you passionate about helping people? Do you love working in a dynamic environment where you will learn new things every day?


We are a team consisting of wide range of skilled people, all with a passion for high tech state of the art software and hardware creating photo-realistic graphics.
You are the expert in your field and are always willing to help others. Apart from making sure clients succeed, you will have a large set of responsibilities and authority to influence in how we improve our offering.


You are naturally service minded, have a strong urge to give high quality help to clients and have the technical knowledge to do so.



Your days will include



  • Investigate and troubleshoot a world leading high-tech product on a very detailed level in the software and in our cloud servers.

  • Resolve client issues – such as software & hardware issues, network, user assistance

  • Compile bug reports and feature requests for development in Jira, work close with the developers

  • Even further enhance client satisfaction, by being an excellent communicator

  • Develop standard procedures and best practices

  • Foster constant exchange with remote team members in Paris and NY

  • Document knowledge in the form of knowledge base tech notes and articles

  • Customize client settings in our backoffice

  • Monitor our ticketing system and assist clients and colleagues

  • Administer all software licenses and SaaS accounts globally

jobs.title: C# .NET Developer
jobs.content:
Mid to senior level C# developer - $110,000/yr full-time working closely with an amazing team of engineers and designers.


New development, complex applications, technically challenging and stimulating work.  We are looking for a Mid to Senior .Net Developer, using your C# ASP.NET MVC5 skill-set. If you are comfortable as a full stack developer, working with the database all the way to the HTML (using AngularJS)...well, this would be great -- what a plus!  Our SaaS solution is built as a single page application on a micro services architecture using sound engineering practices, including code reviews, task branching, continuous integration, and regular release cadences. This job offers you a creative role with a lot of autonomy.  We are a profitable, private equity backed company offering great long term career opportunities. 


Your role
*Work closely with a team of UI / UX Web designers on a daily basis as they'll provide you the business rules, wireframes and HTML/CSS.
*Use your C#, SQL and Javascript to build solutions on our business to government SaaS platform.
*Engage within our development community by sharing best practices, improving standards, and assisting others with their challenges.  
*Work collectively with the entire corporation to create great solutions and deliver excellent customer service.


Skills required
*B.Sc. in Computer Science or similar in experience 
*Mid-Level or Senior Web Developer min 3+years' experience
*C# SQL JAVASCRIPT
*Visual Studio 2015
*Angular experience or understanding 
*Advantageous : Angular JS, Knockout JS, Bootstrap


Benefits:
Medical, vision, dental, 401k with employer matching & tuition reimbursement.

jobs.title: Full-stack developer
jobs.content:
Houd jij van webdevelopment in de breedste zin van het woord? Kun je je volledig storten op de laatste backend-technieken, maar is af en toe een uitstapje naar de voorkant van de applicatie welkom? Voel je je thuis in alle lagen van een applicatie, werk je graag in een klein team, neem je initiatief en werk je zelfstandig? Dan horen we graag wat van je!


Wat ga je doen?


Als developer bij Eveoh zul je hoofdzakelijk werken aan MyTimetable, waarbij zowel de ontwikkeling van nieuwe functionaliteit als de ondersteuning van bestaande klanten onderdeel van je dagelijkse werk is. Je bepaalt in overleg met je collega's de architectuur van de applicatie, implementeert nieuwe functionaliteit, reviewt code van collega's en rolt nieuwe versies uit naar de omgevingen van klanten. Ook ga je zelf op zoek naar de laatste interessante technieken en innoveer of 'refactor' je waar nodig. Meestal werk je vanuit ons kantoor in Den Haag, vlak bij station Hollands Spoor, maar soms maken we een uitstapje naar een klant.


De komende tijd zijn we onder andere bezig met wijzigingsdetectie in persoonlijke roosters, notificaties versturen naar eindgebruikers, herimplementatie van onze REST API, integraties met externe softwarepakketten en het onderzoeken van de mogelijkheden van Reactive Programming.


Wij zoeken:



  • HBO/WO denk- en werkniveau: een papiertje is niet per se van belang, maar we verwachten wel dat je je kennisniveau aan kan tonen.

  • Een ontwikkelaar op junior- of mediorniveau: je mag best direct van de hogeschool of universiteit afkomen, maar enige ervaring is wel vereist om goed aan de slag te kunnen.

  • Ervaring met technieken of tools die we gebruiken is altijd welkom, maar we geloven ook dat dit eigenlijk niet uitmaakt voor een goede developer. De stand van de techniek wijzigt voortdurend, maar om een indruk te geven van onze huidige technologiestack: Java, Spring, GWT, Javascript/CSS/HTML, Backbone, Bootstrap, Gradle, Tomcat, Microsoft SQL Server, ActiveMQ, JMS, IntelliJ IDEA, git, Github, Trello en Jenkins.

  • Zelfstandigheid, maar ook een teamplayer. Een klein team betekent veel verantwoordelijkheid en daar moet je wel van houden en mee om kunnen gaan. Tegelijkertijd begeleiden we je natuurlijk waar nodig, en wordt er vaak overlegd binnen het team om tot de beste oplossingen te komen.

  • Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal, in woord en schrift.


Wij bieden:



  • Veel vrijheid (en verantwoordelijkheid) om onze producten verder te ontwikkelen.

  • Een marktconform salaris. Dat zegt iedereen, en het precieze salaris hangt af van je ervaring, maar reken op € 2.500 tot € 4.000 bruto per maand. Daarnaast natuurlijk 8% vakantiegeld.

  • Initieel een jaarcontract voor 32, 36 of 40 uur per week, met een proeftijd van een maand.

  • 24 vakantiedagen per jaar (bij een 40-urige werkweek).

  • Reiskostenvergoeding: volledige OV-kosten of 19 cent/km wanneer je met eigen vervoer komt.

  • Geen verplichte pensioenregeling. We geloven niet in grote, logge pensioenfondsen. Wel krijg je ondersteuning van professionals bij het zelf regelen van je pensioenzaken.

  • Een laptop van de zaak (tenzij je liever op je eigen hardware werkt, dat mag natuurlijk ook).

  • Alles waar iedere hippe IT startup mee adverteert: goede lunch, vrijmibo, uitjes, flexibele werktijden, fatsoenlijke koffie, enzovoort. We zijn weliswaar al een tijdje geen startup meer, maar die basisvereisten vinden we belangrijk voor een goede werkomgeving.


Heb je interesse?


Stuur dan je cv of LinkedIn-profiel en een korte motivatie naar info@eveoh.nl, of solliciteer via Stack Overflow. We nemen dan binnen twee dagen contact met je op voor een kennismakingsgesprek.


Je mag ook altijd mailen om een keertje informeel kennis te maken tijdens de vrijdagmiddagborrel, vinden wij ook gezellig!

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer for IoT
jobs.content:
The “internet of things” has recently become a big buzzword but Hydrawise has been leading from the front and shipping our internet-enabled smart watering irrigation system since 2011.


Following our recent acquisition by one of the world’s leading irrigation companies, Hunter Industries, Hydrawise is experiencing significant growth and we are expanding our development team to accelerate our innovation and keep our product ahead of the competition.


You’ll be a senior developer working on the front-end (and back-end) of our cloud based application as we add some great new functionality and continue to work to keep our IoT devices at the front of the pack.


We love clean, elegant interfaces which work well in a browser and we love a fast backend so you'll get to use your skills across a wide variety of technologies (and learn some things too).


Working with a small team of talented software engineers you’ll get to have fun coding some cool stuff. The Hydrawise team is small enough that you'll feel like you're directly contributing to something awesome whilst knowing that the product is backed by Hunter Industries - one of the largest irrigation companies in the world.

jobs.title: Full Stack .Net Developer
jobs.content:
We are a passionate team who build modern software used by some of the world's biggest companies and universities.


We are in an exciting growth phase and need your help to power the team to achieve. You will enjoy an exciting career working with cutting-edge technologies and a highly talented team. This is your opportunity to be part of a group that loves to achieve big things and has a great time doing it. 


At Code 360 we are governed by our core values and can only work with people who align with them. They are:



  • Always improving

  • Diligent and dependable

  • Creating elegance, quality and a little magic

  • We're all in this together


You will predominantly:

You will need the following skills:

We are looking for someone with at least 4 years’ relevant experience.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
At HTM we manage two hotels in the Niseko resort in Japan.  Our public face revolves around our Guest Booking Portals, our Agent Booking Portal and Owner's Portal.


These online portals need to to be attractive, informative, easy to use and up to date.  Currently they are not.


We are looking for a Web Developer to become a permanent part of our team, to work with us and guide us to make our public presence represent our hotels, resort and business: modern, professional and fun.


We have a great product, and good understanding of what we need to achieve and a solid back-end database.  But we can't write code (much).


If you are an experienced Web Developer keen to work on a fun, fast-moving, ongoing and challenging project, perhaps with an interest in Japan, skiing or a beautiful mountain location then read-on!


This role is available on a full-time employee basis for a Developer based in Niseko, or on a contract basis for a Developer working remotely (an initial 6-8 week period in Niseko would be required).

jobs.title: Full Stack Consulting Software Engineers
jobs.content:
• Do meaningful work with really smart people

  • Chance to develop your technical skills and play with the latest technologies

  • Join us on our quest to bring best practice software development to the people!

  • Development Only - No pesky technical support required of you (we're like The Thunderbirds ...really!!)


 DiUS is an Australian technology consultancy. We developed our reputation in the Agile, open source development community way before all the cool kids (or the globals) were doing it. Our business is built on providing our clients with solutions to their gnarly technical or business problems. 


Our clients, what we do and how we do it:


Our success has been built on providing our clients with elegant bespoke solutions as well as our ability to uplift the skills of our clients' technology teams; leaving a legacy of technical excellence and sustainable delivery capability.


We engage with companies, big or small who share our values, culture and curiosity to solve problems, create efficiencies and explore the latest technologies.


We're neither a body shop, nor a product house. Developing a relationship (either as an employee or as a client) with DiUS as a client means becoming part of the DiUS family. We work with some of Australia's largest companies, but also actively seek the opportunity to partner with innovative startups to help them along the path to becoming fully fledged businesses.

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer - Applications & Services
jobs.content:
Founded in 2009, SendGrid is an industry-disrupting, cloud-based email company that solves the challenges of reliably delivering emails on behalf of our customers.  We deliver over 25 billion emails a month for customers like Airbnb, Spotify, and Uber.


As a Technical Lead at SendGrid, you will lead a team of passionate developers and help build a first class user experience. This team’s primary objectives are rooted in the web application that is utilized by our customers to access the features of SendGrid. You will have the opportunity to write mission-critical code that enables us to achieve our goal of simplifying communication between businesses and their customers.


What You’ll Do



  • Live by and champion our cultural values of Happy, Hungry, Honest, and Humble

  • Advise the team on technical direction, design, and standards

  • Collaborate with product and engineering management on timeline and implementation details

  • Build and deploy, reliable full-stack web applications and services that support millions of requests per day

  • Work in a dynamic team environment developing and maintaining a high-quality code base with short turnaround times

  • Contribute to continuous improvement of software development best practices in the areas of tools, languages, development processes and APIs

  • We're an agile, fast growing company and this job description isn't meant to be a complete list of your qualifications or all of the things you'll do

jobs.title: Technical Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Hello, future addition to Customer.io! We√¢¬Ä¬ôre looking forward to getting to know you better, but you probably want to know what you√¢¬Ä¬ôre getting yourself into. You can check out our careers page, or read on.

At Customer.io, our mission is to help businesses talk like people. Today, we do this with messaging software that allows businesses with large user-bases to send targeted, more relevant communication at scale. Our customers include Trello, Shutterstock, Handy, and Watsi.

A day in the life of a Technical Support Engineer
A Technical Support Engineer at Customer.io helps new and existing customers get up and running in our product, diagnose tricky situations in the product, and achieve their business goals. Our customers are core to everything we do (it√¢¬Ä¬ôs in our name!) and a Technical Support Engineer has contact with more customers than anyone else in the company.

While support tickets may take most of your day, you√¢¬Ä¬ôll also work on internal and external documentation and have regular touch points with our Product and Customer Success teams to discuss feature requests, usability issues and user scenarios. You√¢¬Ä¬ôll bring your passion for customers and their problems to advocate for product improvements and provide insight that will help us make sure we build the right thing.

Technical Support Engineers develop deep product, systems and customer knowledge. In the long run there are opportunities to apply this knowledge to automate processes, create internal tools or assist our Customer Success and Sales team when technical needs arise. We have many new features to build and ideas to implement, so there will be plenty of exciting challenges ahead.

Tools We Use
Today our Technical Support is powered by Help Scout for tickets, JIRA for bug tracking and Zapier to help automate some of our support processes. We also use some internally built command line tools for problem diagnosis. 

Although, we mostly interact with each other through Basecamp and Slack and value focused work, we√¢¬Ä¬ôre not afraid to jump on a Screenhero pairing session or a video call to clarify customer scenarios or share tips on how to troubleshoot issues better.

We√¢¬Ä¬ôre the right match for you if
  • You love technical problem solving
  • You enjoy helping others with your technical knowledge and take pride in your work.
  • You see every support ticket as an opportunity to improve the customer experience.
  • You take ownership of delivering results and get satisfaction from getting things done.
  • You√¢¬Ä¬ôre passionate about learning new things.
  • You√¢¬Ä¬ôre not afraid to ask questions if you√¢¬Ä¬ôre confused about how something works.
  • You understand written communication is not always perfect and assume the best intentions during interactions with customers and your team. Empathy is one of your strongest attributes.
What we look for:
  • At least 2 years customer support experience.
  • Experience working remotely (it√¢¬Ä¬ôs not your first time holding a full-time or part-time remote job).
  • Comfortable troubleshooting HTML & CSS
  • Basic programming skills and knowledge of the core concepts (Boolean logic, using APIs, control structures,  etc).If you know Javascript - even better!
  • Experience working with or supporting email marketing/ business communication tools preferred.
  • Located in the United States/ Canada or willing to work US Eastern hours.
Why should you work with Customer.io?
We want to enable you to do the best work of your professional life, and this is how we aim to do that:

Salary: This role has a starting salary of $70,000 per year.
Equity: You√¢¬Ä¬ôll own a piece of the company. It's not a get-rich-quick deal, but if you stay around for a while, we're planning to be a long-lasting company, and your piece of it may be a nice bonus.
Big impact: Our team is small, but growing quickly. The work you do will materially impact how successful we are as a company, both with our product and our culture. 

Great tools: Everyone in the company has a budget for a great computer, motorized standing desk, Steelcase Leap office chair, external monitor, and anything else you'd like to get your job done.
Health benefits: We pay 100% of your premiums for medical, dental and vision.
Retreats: We want everyone in our company to connect in person whenever possible, so we get everyone together once a year. We've had retreats in Barcelona, Romania, and Hunter Mountain, NY.
Vacation: Rest and recuperation are important. We offer unlimited paid time off with a two week minimum per year.
Diversity at Customer.io

At Customer.io, we√¢¬Ä¬ôre committed to building a diverse environment, and encourage minority applicants. So far, we have team members in Scotland, Germany, Canada, and all over the US. Our CEO and CTO grew up in Singapore and Arkansas respectively, but met in New York City. Our company culture is always evolving; people from different backgrounds bring valued perspective and thoughtfulness to the work that we do and the culture we foster.

Customer.io provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Customer.io complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Basically, we follow the law, but also like you for who you are!

Intrigued? Talk to us!

To apply: Apply through our jobs site: http://grnh.se/yn5stv, and make sure you tell us why you√¢¬Ä¬ôre interested in the position! We√¢¬Ä¬ôve added a few questions that will also help us understand how you think.

jobs.title: Full-stack Rails Developer
jobs.content:
TL;DR: W-2 Full-time Rails position developing a product you will be proud of with a team that will help you thrive anywhere you want in the U.S. 

What is Kolau

Kolau is a SaaS that is building the marketing of tomorrow - and it√¢¬Ä¬ôs doing it today. 

96% of all businesses have 0-9 employees and Kolau√¢¬Ä¬ôs is their solution to rank in the 1st page of Google. Why? They have no time to do it, knowledge to do it right or money to pay marketing agencies, thus Kolau. Simple, quick, effortless, Kolau.

We√¢¬Ä¬ôre a distributed team, working remotely in the United States and overseas. The engineering team works from the U.S.

Our backend tools are fairly standard - Rails, Postgres, Redis, Rspec, Sidekiq, AWS & Heroku.

What you would be working on? 

With Kolau, we are building a platform that makes it easier for anybody with a website and without any time or marketing knowledge to have it ranking on the 1st page of the search results. Kolau is not just software, though. We have an amazing tech support team that is available in case users need some extra assistance and are as much a part of the Kolau product, success and experience as the platform itself.

Whom are we looking for?

  • Rails developer with a strong sense of commitment and reliability
  • Strong background in Ruby on Rails - ideally 3+ years
  • Fast learner who thrives in a fast-paced environment
  • A developer who is passionate about simple and intuitive solutions
  • Exerience with SaaS development and API development preferred
  • Sound knowledge of SQL and relational databases

Kolau Perks

  • Competitive salary: Competitive compensation package based on experience and location.
  • Wellness: Health insurance and gym membership coverage.
  • Opportunity: Ground floor opportunity to shape the direction of the company
  • Getaways: Company retreat around the world 1x year - Barcelona, anyone?
  • Tech: Brand new Mac Pro and $250 stipend for anything that helps you be more productive
  • Continuing Education: $250 for anything you√¢¬Ä¬ôd like to learn. Also, we ship a new book monthly within your category of interest!

To apply: Please apply here: https://kolau-carrers.workable.com/jobs/334286Impress us with your involvement in the development community, GitHub, Twitter, LinkedIn, blog, or anything else that shows us who you are and why you want to work in Kolau.

jobs.title: Polymath Data Engineer
jobs.content:
From managing the collection and processing of real-time location data - to developing sophisticated geo-spatial algorithms, at Parkour Method, we are passionate in building premium mapping data and location services.


As a Polymath Developer, you will be able to engineer solutions to tough problems related to geospatial analysis, data analytics of user data, and generally developing algorithms and processes for handling lots of data and making it work to provide value for our customers.  You will be working with a combination of technologies you are aware of (Java, Scala, Postgis, Hadoop, etc.) and ones we have had to develop to meet our engineering demands.  You will be helping invent new technologies to tackle problems other organizations are not doing well, and at which we must excel.  


Specifically, you will be working on a variety of tasks.  You will help design architectures, build geospatial algorithms, model data, implement clustering and entity resolution algorithms, and more.  If you like challenging yourself by working in many aspects of computer science and data analytics, and not focusing on one specific aspect; you will love this role.

jobs.title: Member Technology Specialist
jobs.content:
About the Role

We're hiring for a Technology Services, Member Technology Specialist¬†to work in our WeWork buildings. This position will report to the Director of Technology for ServiceDesk.

Department: Technology Services

Department Goals & Objectives

  • Plans and delivers integrated information services to WeWork members and employees
  • Match or exceed WeWork member‚Äôs requirements for technology service delivery
  • Leverages existing, emerging, and innovative technologies to enhance, improve, and streamline technology services for WeWork members
  • Ensures the privacy, integrity, reliability and appropriate use of information resources for all WeWork locations

Position Goals & Objectives

  • To represent the ServiceDesk at all WeWork sites and locations
  • To utilize metrics needed to monitor the availability and reliability of the WeWork member technology infrastructure
  • To advance in the department and take on greater responsibilities as the WeWork Service Desk grows and expands into a global force

Job Description & Responsibilities

  • The Member Technology Specialist¬†(MTS) serves as the primary interface for the WeWork ServiceDesk in the Technology Services division providing stellar support and an unforgettable experience for WeWork members
  • Support the Community and WeWork members by providing prompt response to member problems and requests while managing and maintaining tickets within ZenDesk ticketing system
  • Basic knowledge of data networking principles, architecture, and the ability to speak comfortably about technology to technical, non-technical and super technical members
  • Communicate basic concepts to users of all computer literacy levels, in order to perform training, and support all WeWork members and employees globally
  • Experience with the installation, configuration, and administration of LANs and wireless networks along with other basic networking principles
  • General familiarity with the operation of Microsoft and Apple based business applications and operating systems
  • Installation and configuration of network printing resources including print servers, printers and other peripheral devices.
  • Evaluates and troubleshoot personal computer hardware and software, peripheral devices, mobile devices and network connectivity problems remotely or on site.
  • Lastly, provide a memorable member experience for technology services that surpasses all member expectations.

Language Requirements

  • Both English and Mandarin¬†are required

Critical Competencies for Success

  • Do‚Äôer:
    • You do what you love!
    • Credibility is earned at WeWork through execution and getting things done.¬†
    • You are able to get into the details and deliver results under highest expectations on time and quality.
    • Be ready to get hands-on with all aspects of the daily needs. The buck stops with you.
    • Pragmatism and outcomes orientation are valued and lead to wins.
    • Exceptional organizational and multi-tasking skills.
    • Thrive in a fast-paced environment.
  • Solution-centric:
    • Have the flexibility to think outside on the "box".
    • We don't do everything the traditional way, and are always looking to innovate and push the envelope.¬†
    • Ability to foresee and identify needs of the team.
    • Takes an innovator and creator‚Äôs approach to any issues that may arise.
  • Collaborator:
    • There is no room for ‚ÄúI‚Äù at WeWork.¬† Every role and individual is in the organization to serve We.
    • Builds trust across the organization by being a good listener and inclusively soliciting input.¬†
    • You open to new and innovative solutions.
    • You must present well, and communicate clearly and effectively to upper management and internal departments.
    • Also willing to adjust course when appropriate new ideas or objections are raised.
    • You love working with people!

About WeWork

WeWork is the community of creators. We provide the space, community and services for over tens of thousands of members to do what they love and create their life's work. WeWork‚Äôs mission is to build a world where people work to make a life, not just a living. Our own team members are central to this mission.

The WeWork team is a group of entrepreneurial, grateful individuals who deeply believe in what we are creating and in the power of ‚Äúwe‚Äù. We challenge convention and achieve amazing things through dedication and collaboration.

WeWork transforms buildings into beautiful, collaborative work spaces and provides infrastructure, services, events and technology so our members can focus on doing what they love. Our team members value the WeWork concept and there is a contagious energy in our offices as we work towards accomplishing our goals.

Our hunger for building great spaces, empowering small businesses and connecting interesting people hasn't yet begun to be satisfied. We are just getting started, and our journey gets increasingly more exciting as team members join our mission!


Our values guide who we are and everything that we do.¬†

Inspired

We do what we love and are connected to something greater than ourselves.


Entrepreneurial

We are creators, leaders and self-starters.¬† We try new things; we challenge convention; and we‚Äôre not afraid to fail.


Authentic

We are genuine to our brand, mission and values.¬† We‚Äôre not perfect and we don‚Äôt pretend to be.¬† We are, though, always honest and as transparent as we can be.¬†

Tenacious

We never settle.¬† We get sh*t done and we get it done well.¬† Be persistent and knock down walls ‚Äì literally if you have to.¬† You have our permission.


Grateful

We are grateful for each other, our members, and to be part of this movement.¬† We don‚Äôt take success for granted.¬† We‚Äôre happy to be alive.

Together

We are in this together.¬† This is a team effort.¬† We always look out for one another.¬†We value empathy; we know we‚Äôre all human, and know we can‚Äôt do any of this alone.¬†

jobs.title: Rails Dev (fight cancer, improve young adult health, integrate everything)
jobs.content:
We are looking for a developer to help us build excellent web-based applications and mobile apps. In return, we want to help you put the right mix of the right work into the Big Picture of your life.

We work with great clients on fun projects. A few examples of current work include:
  • Building an interface for a causal inference model built by leading bioinformatics researchers to provide personalized identification of cancer drivers.
  • Working with a world-class clinical care team to build an app / messaging system to help guide young adults to good health using a machine learning-based recommender system.
  • Launching an e-commerce integration product (flowlink.io) that allows online retailers to easily automate many of their most tedious tasks.
NuRelm provides a wide range of experience, plenty of room for professional growth, a fun workplace, and an environment everyone on the team is valued. We are looking for a smart person who loves the Web, loves to learn, and enjoys working on a variety of technologies and projects.

REQUIREMENTS
  • Very comfortable with Rails, MySQL, Git (2 to 5 years min).
  • Experienced building and consuming RESTful APIs.
  • Experienced working with and on Linux/Unix operating systems.
  • Good understanding of front-end technologies, including JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3/SASS in the Rails environment.
  • Habits that include test-driven development and an agile project approach
  • Experienced assembling projects from the ground up, and the eye for architecture and planning that goes with that.
  • A North American time zone and strong English communication skills (we have a local team in Pittsburgh, but also work with remote developers).
  • Please, no recruiters or firms offering subcontracting.

BONUS POINTS
  • Experienced with Sinatra, MongoDB, React JS, AWS.
  • Familiarity with MVC and prototyping.
  • Experienced with working remotely.
  • Know your way around Docker and typical stacks such as Rails / Unicorn / Nginx.
  • Familiar and willing to do an occasional project with PHP.

A FEW BENEFITS
  • Excellent medical, vision, and dental insurance
  • Retirement plan with employer matching
  • New hires start with 3 weeks of vacation
  • Competitive compensation
  • A fun, compassionate, smart, and diverse team

To apply: Please note that we are firm on the requirements from above that we are not looking for recruiters or firms offering subcontracting, and that we are seeking applicants with a North American time zone.To apply, please submit a brief cover letter and a resume to humanresources at nurelm.com.

jobs.content: Revcontent in currently seeking a Sr. Aerospike Architect to join our team. Revcontent is the fastest growing Native Advertising network in the world serving over 200 BILLION content recommendations a month. As a Sr. Aerospike Architect, you will contribute to the system development and optimization. jobs.content: This individual will work closely with other core developers and traders to enhance our low latency core trading systems.  This role is hands-on is fast paced and close to the action.

jobs.title: Full Stack Web Developer
jobs.content:
Your Mission
Nulogy is looking for developers that love solving difficult domain problems. If pair programming, TDD, continuous integration, story walls, and retrospectives are your thing, then you’re halfway there. Couple that with a sense of humour, humility, and strong work ethic and we’re intrigued. Studied DDD or GOOS? We should definitely talk!


Job Responsibilities
As a full stack web developer, you will be working on Nulogy’s product suite that serves the supply chain industry. You will work in an agile team environment practising XP. You will work on all areas of the code base and apply both your creativity and pragmatism to an endless assortment of domain and technical challenges.

jobs.title: JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
Geographic Research is the developer of SimplyMap, a B2B SaaS mapping, visualization, and data analytics application that makes it easy for anyone to make maps and analyze geographic data. SimplyMap's powerful visual analytics let users identify target locations, map competition, track how places change over time, and identify where to market products. We are passionate about creating outstanding software, and we believe in automated testing, continuous integration, and code review.


We are looking for a client-side JavaScript developer with experience working on complex single-page applications. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, has a high level of attention to detail, is comfortable asking questions, enjoys working with talented colleagues, and has an interest in analytics and data visualization.


Our developers can live and work anywhere in the United States or Canada. This is a full-time salaried position.


Skills & Requirements:



  • Expert client-side JavaScript skills

  • Strong UI development skills (CSS & HTML)

  • Open to learning new technologies

  • Self-starter who gets things done

  • Attention to detail


We look forward to receiving your application.

jobs.title: Database Administrator
jobs.content:
Purpose of the Position



As part of our skilled DBA team, the position is integral in the monitoring, maintenance and development of our database solutions. The position is located in Newton, NJ.



Essential Job Functions include the following, but are not limited to:




  • Conduct monitoring, maintenance and development of our database solutions; including business critical reporting and BI systems.

  • Deliver projects with state of the art HW, SW and latest SQL releases.

  • Global user support, training and solution design.

  • Troubleshoot technical issues and identify modifications needed in existing applications to meet changing user requirements.

  • Manage and maintain optimal performance of business critical applications, including DynamicsAX

  • Manage security role modifications, reports, forms and setups in the enterprise system, which do not require technical development expertise.

  • Manage the lifecycle of modifications with the developer.

  • Would require understanding manufacturing and lean processes to execute some of the functional specifications

  • Evaluate and installs patches, and resolves server software related problems

  • Manage and maintain Disaster Recovery Plan for application systems

  • Remotely manage applications and systems in various facilities around the globe

  • Assist in the management of system backups and recovery systems

  • Assist in the management and maintenance antivirus solutions




In addition to the essential functions and duties listed above, all positions are also responsible for:



  • Meeting company standards pertaining to quantity and quality of work performed on an ongoing basis, performing all work related tasks in a manner that is in compliance with all Company policies and procedures.

  • Adhering to Company policies, procedures, and directives regarding standards of workplace behavior in completing job duties and assignments.


The Company retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position.







Physical Activities:




This is largely a sedentary role; however, some filing is required. This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand as necessary.






Qualifications






Experience:




·         2+ years of experience with:


o   SLQ: clustering, mirroring, replication, scripting, stored procedures, functions, performance tuning and trouble shooting.


o   SSRS: Installing and configuring SSRS and development of reports


o   SSAS: Cube and DWH development.














Education:





  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering/Science, or equivalent work experience.














Specialized Knowledge and Skills:





  • SQL 2008, 2012

  • Knowledge of ERP system databases, preferable MS Dynamics/Axapta.

  • Ability to backup/restore, including disaster recovery tasks

  • Full understanding of product release cycle

  • Knowledge of best practices in the area of data security

  • Strong ability to work in a team environment.

  • Strong communication skills.














Other:




NA







Organizational Relationships






Direct Reports:




This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities.







Thorlabs values its diverse environment and is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.  All qualified individuals will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identify or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age or veteran status. Job descriptions are not intended as and do not create employment contracts.  The organization maintains its status as an at-will employer.  Employees can be terminated for any reason not prohibited by law.

jobs.title: Embedded Firmware Engineer
jobs.content:
Purpose of the Position


Thorlabs is seeking an embedded firmware engineer to participate in the development of next generation scientific instruments.


We are seeking an insightful, talented, dedicated engineer to contribute to our fast paced and dynamic R&D environment within Thorlabs’ Quantum Electronics Division. The successful candidate will plan, design, develop, and implement real-time firmware for microcontrollers to be used in complex instruments. The candidate is also expected to develop basic software and user interfaces as well as SDKs. Activities include design documentation, prototype verification and debug, test development and transfer to manufacturing. This position requires troubleshooting of complex electronics and system problems, and being committed to customer satisfaction. Preference will be given to candidates with a broad range of interests and skills.


Essential Job Functions include the following, but are not limited to:



  • Responsible for generating all necessary embedded firmware and software for product development, product launch, and support. Design and support documentation including, but not limited to: firmware theory of operation, SDK definition, source control and revision tracking, test procedures, and end user’s manuals.

  • Developing and testing next generation embedded software / firmware and electronics for driving and controlling advanced laser imaging products.

  • Interfacing with R&D engineers, test engineers,  other design engineers, and production staff to develop robust, producible systems that adhere to regulatory and compliance requirements

  • Support migration of systems from design phase to manufacturing phase

  • Complies with safety regulations and maintains clean and orderly work areas


In addition to the essential functions and duties listed above, all positions are also responsible for:



  • Meeting company standards pertaining to quantity and quality of work performed on an ongoing basis, performing all work related tasks in a manner that is in compliance with all Company policies and procedures.

  • Adhering to Company policies, procedures, and directives regarding standards of workplace behavior in completing job duties and assignments.


The Company retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position.


Physical Activities:


This is largely a sedentary role; however, some filing is required. This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand as necessary.


Qualifications


Experience:


·         Preferred 5+ years’ experience with embedded software / firmware and electronics design for high performance scientific instrumentation. Interest and/or experience in digital feedback controller design, real-time embedded operating systems, simulation and implementation a plus.


·         Significant experience and detailed working knowledge of embedded hardware, such as microprocessor and microcontroller based control and monitoring circuits.


·         Direct experience with writing FW on small CPU's e.g. processors based on the ARM Cortex-M4F such as the STM32 F4


·         Proficient in C/C++ for embedded systems development


·         Proficient in using electronic measuring test tools, designing methods for testing "real time" performance of HW/firmware timing.


·         Experience with developing firmware for real-time I2C, SPI, USB protocols.


Education:


·         MS or BS in electrical engineering, computer engineering or related field with minimum of 5 years of experience.


Specialized Knowledge and Skills:


·         Strong ability to work well in a group atmosphere, and comply with high quality standards


·         Proven expertise in troubleshooting and resolving electronic issues in instruments using oscilloscopes, DVM’s, logic analyzers, and other standard lab test equipment.


·         Exposure to Revision control software preferably Git or Subversion


·         Proficient in KEIL Development Environment


·         Direct experience and ability to read PCB schematics.


·         Exposure to and interfacing with FPGA fabric (experience with system on a chip technology a plus)


·         PID control implementation in Firmware.


Other:


NA


Organizational Relationships


Direct Reports:


This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities.


Thorlabs values its diverse environment and is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.  All qualified individuals will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identify or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age or veteran status. Job descriptions are not intended as and do not create employment contracts.  The organization maintains its status as an at-will employer.  Employees can be terminated for any reason not prohibited by law.

jobs.title: Marketing Events Manager
jobs.content:
Why Pure

We‚Äôre here with the humble aspiration to accelerate the speed of human progress with our radically simple, all-flash enterprise storage technology. We‚Äôre driven by our belief that storage isn‚Äôt just a place to put things, it‚Äôs a powerful force to be unleashed - a force that will remove the limitations on those building the world of today, so they can erase the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù from¬†tomorrow.¬†¬†Our all-flash storage solutions offer radically simple technology to help companies unlock their future possibilities, today.

Our founders created the company with a passion to build storage technology customers love and deliver it with simplicity and service that fundamentally changes the enterprise storage experience. Founded in 2009, our record revenue growth¬†has landed us among a very select group of companies. Today, customers and industries across the world are experiencing the benefits of going Pure - from Barclays to Linkedin.com and ConocoPhillips, Pure adopters cover a broad spectrum from global consumer brands, to healthcare, education and finance.¬†

Our Team

Puritans come from various backgrounds and we thrive off of challenging the norm. This cross pollination of backgrounds led to numerous ground breaking ideas and has helped us build one of the most reliable and easy to use storage systems in the industry. ‚ÄãWe strive to hire the best and brightest people, who excel in a cutting edge, fast paced, collaborative and transparent environment.¬† We are seeking enthusiastic individuals to solve real world problems while having fun along the way.

What You Will Be Doing

  • Global partner and alliance events (upwards of 15+ events per year with serious growth potential)
  • One of the main POCs for Pure//Accelerate, our annual user conference¬†
  • Manage everything from event inception to completion including budget, lead gen, brand presence, staffing, etc ¬†
  • Evaluate event presence and make recommendations to team
  • Work cross-departmentally (PM, IM, DG, Sales, etc) to ensure event success
  • Liason with unions and contracting agencies managing trade shows and booth builds
  • Partner with DG and social media teams to coordiante outreach to generate buzz at events
  • Managing post event ROI ($$ and brand)
  • Work with internal teams following up on leads post event to generate business opportunities
  • Track campaign success throughout SFDC and Marketo
  • Build brand advocates in emerging regions
  • Create unique marketing campaigns to drive event attendance¬†
What You Bring To The Team
  • Strong field and events¬†marketing expertise
  • 4+ years of event marketing experience.
  • Strong written, oral, interpersonal and presentation skills.
  • Strong project management, negotiation and decision-making skills.
  • Experience in working with a sales team.
  • Self-motivated, innovative and creative.

Pure is a very special place. What makes and keeps us special is who we recruit to join us and how we work together. Our culture was shaped organically as our early team poured their heart and soul into Pure‚Äôs first generation product and supporting our early customers and partners.¬† We expect each employee to approach their job at Pure with the same level of pride and care, and perpetuate the values that are making us the best storage company in history.

At the center of those values is the belief that the single most important thing we do is continue to hire the best and create a workplace where they thrive and enjoy. To reward our employees for the great work they‚Äôre doing we offer a number of perks and benefits, including:

  • Flexible vacation - take time off when you need it
  • Exceptional medical benefits with 100% employer paid premiums
  • Commuter benefits for public transit and bicycle commuters
  • Free lunches, dinners, and fully stocked snacks & beverages
  • Lounge areas with ping pong, foosball, pinball, and arcade games
