jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)
jobs.content:
Your impact

As a dedicated Site Reliability Engineer you will help us define the best practices, tools and automation to ensure our fast growing SaaS provides best in class high availability while increasing engineering velocity. Your work will empower more than 7,000 businesses around the world to deliver a great customer support experience. This is a critical role that will influence every engineer in the company and directly impact our customer's satisfaction. No matter how elegant our product is, it means little if customers can't always access our site with great performance.

ABOUT THE ROLE
  • We are looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to build sophisticated continuous delivery and test automation to keep our AWS-based services highly available and fast while increasing the engineering team's velocity.
  • Help Scout engineering is 24 full time engineers organized into 6 teams. You will be a member of a small team with one engineer focused on continuous delivery (CD) pipelines, and 3 engineers focused on our AWS infrastructure and operations. Working with your team, you will partner with our feature delivery teams to build any automation they need to improve site reliability and velocity.
  • You will be responsible for working on our three biggest site reliability priorities: four 9s high availability, continuous delivery and test automation. You will own the implementation and roadmap planning for improvements to our automation, tools and tests to support these priorities. The majority of your time will be spent building or implementing continuous delivery, test and self-healing automation and supporting tools. You will be a key internal champion for any and all changes to make our production environments more resilient, scalable, and performant.
  • Your potential projects will include expanding our CI pipeline across all teams, testing and implementing auto-scaling groups, expanding our test automation (smoke, stress, chaos monkey, etc), and enhancing the velocity of our CI pipeline (parallel tasks, containers, etc).
  • This is not a primary on-call position. However you should expect to be called upon if services you own such as CD pipelines or test automation fail and primary on-call team members can't resolve the issue.
  • Our 100% remote engineering team spends most of their time in Slack and Github. Engineers can focus for long stretches with typically only 2 scheduled meetings a week (one with your team and one with your manager). Engineers write their own automated unit and integration tests, and use our CI pipeline to release code to production several times a day. You can read more about our culture and how our remote team stays agile at https://www.helpscout.net/blog/agile-remote-teams/

REQUIREMENTS

About You
  • You love building test automation that finds site reliability problems before they hit production while allowing software engineering teams to continuously deliver new capabilities.
  • You have worked extensively with a wide range of Amazon Web Services (EC2, ELB, EBS, RDS, VPCs, CloudFormation, etc) and are familiar with the benefits and challenges of their offerings. You know how to design systems for failure and how to autoscale and recover systems on AWS to ensure high availability.
  • You are well-versed in modern system orchestration, configuration management, and application deployment tooling and practices.
  • You have designed continuous delivery and test automation for SaaS projects supporting tens of thousands of simultaneous active users, so you have a good sense of what the road ahead looks like and what we could be doing better.
  • You have a deep understanding of what it takes to run web services at scale and have a solid understanding of Linux systems internals and networking; from kernel to shell, system libraries, file systems and client-server protocols.
  • You love to dig into the details and automate manual processes whenever possible. You're comfortable with tools providing operational insights, log searching, and stats analysis.
  • A big part of being great at your job revolves around being very organized and communicative. It√¢¬Ä¬ôs clear from your experience that you have those characteristics.
  • You√¢¬Ä¬ôve got a strong engineering background and have done a little of everything. It√¢¬Ä¬ôs clear you are a curious person that prefers to get stuff done rather than delegate.

ABOUT US

  • Help Scout is a remote team with employees in eleven countries (eight people in the Boston office). We optimize for excellence over geography and overcome remote challenges through transparency, trust, chat and video conferencing.
  • We√¢¬Ä¬ôre a customer-driven company and always will be. Everything follows the customer experience, no exceptions.
  • Our company is growing quickly and has aspirations of helping millions of people around the world. Accomplishing our goals will present countless challenges and require you to excel in every aspect of the position. It√¢¬Ä¬ôs hard work, but the people we√¢¬Ä¬ôre looking for love exploring and solving hard problems.
  • This is not the typical startup √¢¬Ä¬úrocket ship√¢¬Ä¬ù. We√¢¬Ä¬ôll never compromise customers or the experience in favor of growth. Our purpose is to build a profitable company that small businesses love and sustain it. We optimize your career at Help Scout for the long term as well, so keeping a healthy work/life balance is an important priority.
  • We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

BENEFITS

  • Competitive Salary - We pay at or above market salary in most cases and evaluate a lot of research to make sure everyone is paid well. The formula we use to calculate all salaries is public to employees and is improved upon regularly.
  • Work anywhere - Work from our office in Boston or anywhere else, provided you have 4 hours of overlap with the team. We√¢¬Ä¬ôll even buy your home office furniture or help you pay for a co-working space.
  • Health and dental insurance - We cover you and your family's health/dental insurance 100%. If you are based in the US, we'll cover you on our Harvard Pilgrim HMO or PPO policies.
  • Long-term/Short-term Disability Insurance & Life Insurance - we cover 100% of the premiums for LT/ST Disability insurance and base Life Insurance. You also have the option to purchase supplementary life insurance through our provider.
  • International Benefit Stipend - If you√¢¬Ä¬ôre based outside the US, you√¢¬Ä¬ôll receive a monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, long and short-term disability, and accountant costs.
  • Flexible vacation - Take time off when you need it, we trust you.
  • Paid parental leave, including adoption - 12 weeks if you have or adopt a baby, 4 weeks if your partner has a baby.
  • 401k with 1% match- 1% Retirement Plan matching for both US and International Employees
  • Personal development stipend - Up to $1,800 per year to improve your craft
  • Great tools - Each employee receives a Mac laptop and 27'' display (or equivalent). We√¢¬Ä¬ôll also purchase any of the software or hardware you need.
  • Complete transparency - Everyone has full access to business metrics and financial information about the company.

To apply: https://help-scout.workable.com/jobs/171036

Duties:
* Website Content: Leverage knowledge of current SEO and web design practices to update website content (pages, press releases, events, articles, etc.) as directed.  Must have proven experience maintaining visually appealing websites that attract and convert. 
* Email Campaigns: Implement email campaigns as directed by the Marketing Manager and Technical Marketing team and provide insight to management through analytics and reporting.
* Adwords: Implement and monitor Google Adwords and remarketing campaigns.

Experience and Requirements:

* Intermediate HTML/CSS skills with knowledge of best SEO practices.
* Strong written communication skills.
* Proven project management abilities.

Candidate to work remotely an average of 30 hours per week and must be available by phone or email for at least 4 hours during the US office workday (8am-5pm Pacific Time Zone). This is a contract position that does not include 401K, health benefits, or sick/vacation pay.

jobs.title: Director of Engineering - Software
jobs.content:
About us:
At Siempo we believe technology should be simple and mindful. We realized that we were constantly distracted and feeling over-connected by our smartphones. We couldn√¢¬Ä¬ôt find solutions we believed in, so we decided to build something new.

Siempo is a mindful phone with a focused feature-set of calling, texting, notes, calendar and Wi-Fi tethering. The natural language UX is designed to help minimize distractions and the focus feature helps you shield against distractions and do more of what you love.

Previously known as Minium(http://minium.co), we have iterated on the product direction over the past year and are thrilled to launch our new brand and a crowdfunding campaign this fall.

We√¢¬Ä¬ôre now looking for someone to drive our software team and deliver a beautiful, inspiring experience; someone excited about reshaping the way we interact with technology and playing a significant role in the early stages of a hardware-enabled software startup. We hope this person is you.

We√¢¬Ä¬ôre a small team based in Oakland and Chicago who are passionate about mindfulness, work-life balance and technology. We√¢¬Ä¬ôre focused on getting things done. Both as a company and as co-workers we value transparency and collaboration. We believe work should be fun and care as much about the culture as the product.

About you:
You speak Android OS fluently and are experienced with hardware projects. You√¢¬Ä¬ôve worked with independent design houses and/or ODMs, ideally in Asia. We imagine that you have brought up an OS on a new device, or developed a hardware/software product from scratch and taken it to mass market production. You know what it takes to work in a startup, you√¢¬Ä¬ôre self-motivated and know how to lead a distributed team.

To apply: If this sounds like a fun challenge, please apply at http://siempo.co/apply.htmlYou may submit any supporting files that speak to who you are as a person and why you would be a good fit for this position. Resumes/CVs are great, but we√¢¬Ä¬ôre also interested in anything that goes beyond such as past work or projects, GitHub account, or your personal blog.We read every application and look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Coach & Engineer
Senior Finance Associate
jobs.content:
Bonobos is¬†seeking¬†a Senior Finance Associate to¬†lead the charge on¬†financial forecasting, business planning and ongoing analytical support as we¬†continue to¬†scale the business.¬†¬†

Reporting directly to the Finance Manager, you will be part of the dynamic duo responsible for informing, implementing and guiding the strategic direction of our two largest and fastest growing channels. Interacting with department leads, Finance Director and CFO, you'll help evolve and lead our financial planning process as an integral part of a small and scrappy finance team, applying ¬†analytical rigor to constantly optimize the scalability and value of the business. ¬†We know‚Ä¶ heavy stuff. But we know you'll have fun! ¬†¬†

What you'll do...

  • Support the planning, forecasting and long range planning process for the e-Commerce and Guideshop Businesses while striving to maximize total company profitability including:
    • All aspects of the P&L but especially revenue KPIs in partnerships with cross functional teams
    • Continuous improvement of channel profitability analysis with focus on simplification, efficiency and improved accuracy and insight
    • Supporting process development for ongoing managerial reporting, including variance analysis to budget/forecast and interpretation of key themes and actionable items for senior management
    • Lead and participate in ad-hoc projects such as (but not limited to): hindsighting, cannibalization analysis, sales forecasting, long range planning, fleet review, deep-dives
    • Nurture flourishing collaborative working relationships with all business partners including Planning, Guideshop Field Ops, Guideshop Strategy, Store Visual, Store Construction, Marketing, Data Science, Operations and Accounting
    • Maintain financial planning and reporting architecture, ensuring cross-platform data integrity
    • Demonstrate judgement and comfort with data ambiguity; filling in the holes and communicating assumptions appropriately
  • Provide support to the Finance team on group deliverables such as BoD presentations and CFO requests
  • Run business analysis such as business cases, modeling operating changes, and new views on P&L analysis
  • Function-led process improvement activities and other special projects (such as creation of standardized budget templates, harmonization of business and financial processes, ongoing implementation of our planning tool: Host Analytics)

¬†¬†

You...

  • Have at least three years banking and / or corporate finance experience,¬†extra points for retail experience
  • Are an Excel master and can go hours without ever touching a mouse but are also able to wield modeling wizardry within the constraints of a thriving business
  • Are not afraid of PowerPoint!¬†
  • Desire to continuously develop financial understanding while continuously drawing connections between previous and current work
  • Know your way around financial statements, their independencies, and are a veteran at building fully functional company models
  • Have a strong ability to prioritize and manage multiple assignments, ¬†take initiative and work independently
  • Maintain strong interpersonal and communication skills in addition to comfort presenting to¬†executives
  • Want to work in a fast-paced, energetic environment where culture matters and everyone is given a path to success
  • Want to hang up your "suit and tie", and be a part of a rapidly growing company¬†backed by major VC firms
  • Are looking to join a team that is truly engaging, fulfilling, energetic, quirky, and always passionate¬†

We‚Ä¶¬†

  • Value self-awareness, intellectual honesty, judgment, empathy and positive energy, often, over experience
  • Put our customers' experience with Bonobos into every decision we make¬†
  • Want someone that is both a creative ¬†problem solver and detail-oriented
  • Treat every order as if it is the most important order
  • Work hard because we love what we‚Äôre doing, but also highly value personal downtime that does not include pants (designing them, selling them, shipping them...wearing them?)
  • Will back up our talk with a competitive compensation and benefits package, challenging projects, random acts of team-wide fun, awesome co-workers¬†
  • Are excited to hear from you

jobs.title: Entry Mid level Front end Web Developer
jobs.content:
JS full-time dev


We're looking for someone who likes to take ownership of a project, and see it through to completion, with or without supervision. Our stack is really new (about 2 months old) and focuses on a predictable, functional, reliable frontend… React + Observables + redux-like-stores + angular in an iframe for legacy support + native app that renders webpages as video and delivers them to Facebook (and other video services) + ruby-on-rails api backend (all json).

The right candidate would be excited about being our first dev hire. There’s currently only 4 full-time founders (+ 2 part-time employees). Our product helps big brands like NBC, BuzzFeed, the New York Times, Reuters, Nasdaq, TED talks, and more broadcast high quality video to Facebook Live. We've grown really fast and can continue to do so with the right technical talent. We think this is a great fit for someone who thinks they could be great with the right mentorship. (We have one of the guys who built a js video player for one of the biggest companies in the world.)

We’re previously funded by Y Combinator, and some angel investors. At this time, we do not expect to raise further funding. We’re currently profitable, and expect this to be our only company we work at for the next 50 years. We will not be selling the company unless some insane whatsapp like thing happened. We're building a forever biz, not a flip. We'd love for our perfect employee to be excited about small companies and startups, and we'd expect the right candidate to use us as a learning experience to maybe make the next step into a senior developer role.

We value diverse applicant pools, so if you're part of an under-represented population in tech, we hope you'll apply. Specifically we'd love to see more women and people of color apply.

We value people’s home lives. We work hard but some of the founders work 4-day weeks. Other coworkers are encouraged to do this schedule if it works for them. We also value remote work, and have cofounders in Finland and Pakistan, which should emphasize our preference for results over face time for the sake of facetime.

To apply email hiring@vidpresso.com with a quick bio including: What you’ve built, what you like to build, what you wish you could build.

jobs.title: Angular and Node.js Senior Application Engineer
jobs.content:
A Stealthy Startup is looking for asenior software engineer to join a distributed team and make significant contributions to designing, building and leading efforts to greenfield our application to market.  We are focused on delivering low-cost, highly scale-able, high performing, easy-to-use data analytics, intelligence and business orchestration tools rooted in distilling down hard answers to big questions from mountains of data and presenting it in a way that is accessible and actionable for users.

Software Engineer
  Now that you have an overview of the company's mission, let√¢¬Ä¬ôs talk a little about the specific opportunity.  We are looking to add to a team of hard core engineers who are as passionate as we are about building great applications using modern technologies as design pattern as we are.  We are a team of aces who are greenfielding a lot of this now so if you are the right candidate for this role, greenfielding this part of the application with us should be something that excites you, not something that makes you want to crawl under your desk.  We are looking for intelligent, diligent hard working individual(s) who not only are technical powerhouses and self-starters, but also come armed with superior communication skills, ability to fill in the blanks when you encounter one and are interested in taking on big challenges and succeeding.  Make no mistake, this is a multidisciplinary software development role in a small company with big aspirations, your technical skills will be challenged.  If you√¢¬Ä¬ôre detail-oriented, then we probably love you already.  If you are hungry to take on big challenges and ready to make an impact with your engineering and simultaneously hone your skills on the latest technologies along the way; then you√¢¬Ä¬ôve definitely come to the right place.
If you√¢¬Ä¬ôre right for us...

You√¢¬Ä¬ôre good at:
  • Developing enterprise-grade software in a fast moving environment
  • Working in a results oriented culture that uses modern, sprint based collaboration tools ( Short  and productive sprints aided with tools like Trello, Slack and Google Hangouts )
  • Skills and passion for developing lightning fast, scalable applications that solve real-world business problems in modern technologies like Node JS, JavaScript, Angular JS, etc.  In case you are wondering, this is a hard core full stack engineering opportunity, not √¢¬Ä¬údeveloping a website√¢¬Ä¬ù.
  • The understanding of team strategies and team objectives
  • The motivation to learn and constantly improve process and tools
  • The people skills required to work with us on a fluid and dynamic environment
  • Working in MVC environments
  • Building software that runs fast and scales giving the user the best possible experience
  • Building software without bugs [ your software never has bugs, right? :) ]
  • Logic and solving puzzles
  • Empathizing with users who actually use the software
  • Working in a distributed team

You Have
  • The appetite to greenfield with us as we go on this journey
  • The performance track record to confidently take pride in your work
  • The chops to never back away from a challenge, technical or otherwise
  • The vision to build things right the first time
  • The ability to pick out the syntax problem in the next section
  • An overlap of at least 4 hours with the Eastern Standard Time work-day
  • Speak/write/communicate/comprehend/joke fluently in English...although many of us are multi-lingual, we use English to communicate.

We have
  • Vision, experience and dedication
  • A team of aces to work with
  • A culture of excellence, results and accountability
  • A stack with the latest open source technologies ( Angular JS, Node JS specifically Sails JS for an enterprise-grade MVC design pattern but with support for the type of modern apps we are looking to build (eg. data-driven API√¢¬Ä¬ôs with a scalable service-oriented architecture).
  • An open mind for new ideas of methodologies
  • Cloud based, Linux open source environment (eg. think Ubuntu on AWS) and the Amazon stack and services to help us develop and scale quickly.
  • Flexible work schedule, distributed work opportunities and flexible work location benefits

A Day in the life ( at our current stage )
  • We do a daily development stand-up and review our Trello board to review:
  • What is completed
  • What is tracking on-time
  • What is tracking red
  • When will it be green
  • Are you blocked by anything? --What do you need from anyone in this room to continue
  • What you should be working on next
  • Discuss any larger architecture decisions
  • Ask what can we do to improve our [ process, communication, application, architecture ]
  • Communicate and collaborate and be a real team
  • Exchange a Meme and laugh once in awhile...okay, probably more than once in awhile

To apply: Send your resume/CV and cover note explaining why you are the right candidate for this opportunity to recruiting@rekener.com

jobs.title: Looking For Hungry All round Dev Working On A Top Design Tool With Web Tech
jobs.content:
We are a raising startup creating the design tool 'Gravit' used by hundred-thousands of designers. The tool is based on bleeding edge web technology yet also runs natively on Mac, Windows, Linux, iPad, iPhone and much more. Furthermore the core engine is powerful enough to even run in modern cars, in the industry and many more uses cases. You'll be working with a few of the top notch developers on an engine and design tool that has more code lines than even google docs yet is very easily maintainable.


The work consists of many different tasks, be it fixing a bug (as usual ;)), creating new interactive design elements and controls, working on the engine and animations, defining the design tool user interface as well as working on the backend (NodeJS & MongoDB). No task is like the other one thats what makes working for Gravit so exciting. If you're looking for a challenge and you're an all-round talent not being bound to a specific framework then here's your chance to participate in a young, hungry startup with the option for equity if reasonable.

Our fast-paced environment and can do attitude have already earned usseveral prestigious awards including this year's Gold Stevie for best financialservices website from the American Business Awards and a gold medal as one ofthe products of the year from the Consumer World Awards.  We're seekinghardworking, like-minded individuals to help us disrupt personal finance andmake a tangible difference in people's everyday lives.

More specifically, we are harnessing the power of dataanalytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financialadvisor, whose services we√¢¬Ä¬ôre offering to everyone for free. The WalletHubbrain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of thetime with three unique features:

  1. Customized Credit-Improvement Tips: WalletHub identifiesimprovement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.

In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHubis the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full creditreports that are updated on a daily basis absentof user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logsin. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yetthey√¢¬Ä¬ôre still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a muchlarger puzzle.

jobs.title: Direct Response Copywriter For Professional Services (B2B LeadGen)
jobs.content:
Our company helps small professional service firms, such as lawyers or accountants, generate new business through direct response marketing and advertising. We manage campaigns both online and offline.

We need a conversion-minded copywriter to help create new campaigns for our current and incoming clients.

This is a contract position with the potential to grow into permanent full-time employment. All work will be done remotely, and we are seeking candidates with previous remote work experience.

You must have previous experience writing and optimizing direct-response campaigns. We work with online landing pages, email autoresponders, and direct-mail formats.

Most of our projects start from scratch.  A typical client's business has grown to a 10-30 employee firm over many years prior to partnering with Tall Cube.  Most of these firms have grown from word of mouth alone and are now looking to scale.

Our focus, and what we're looking for in your previous experience, is developing lead-generation campaigns using a methodology rooted in rapid testing. We don't value being right or wrong on the first try. Instead, we look to prove meaningful optimization over time.

Tall Cube√¢¬Ä¬ôs work culture is one where √¢¬Ä¬úgood and fast√¢¬Ä¬ù receives more praise than √¢¬Ä¬úperfect next year√¢¬Ä¬ù. You will be expected to write drafts quickly. At the same time, we won√¢¬Ä¬ôt expect copy written during a rapid-testing schedule to rival Shakespeare.

However, there is a time and place for painstaking detail during deep optimization efforts on well-established campaigns.

You'll work with our team to write, test, compare your copy√¢¬Ä¬ôs performance across numerous creative variations.

You'll be responsible for:
Writing and editing direct-response copy in line with client strategy
Developing converting lead-generation landing pages
Writing autoresponder email copy for professional clients
Drafting and improving physical direct-mail copy
Maintaining a professional client relationship

We are particularly interested in someone with:
Direct-response marketing experience
Experience advertising across several mediums
Previous results with lead-generation and/or B2B campaigns
Strong understanding of media buying
Previous experience optimizing and scaling existing campaigns

Thank you for your interest in our copywriting position.

To apply: If you would like to apply, please send your resume in an email with the subject "Tall Cube Copywriter" to team@tallcube.com.In your message, please include answers to the following questions:1) Do you have a online portfolio or resume? If so, please provide a URL.2) Briefly describe your experience as a copywriter. What products or services have you promoted? In which medium have you performed best?3) Have you had an experience where the approach your client most desired was opposite from the approach that best converted? If so, how did you handle the situation?4) Tell us about a piece of copy that inspires you. What makes it special?

jobs.title: Frontend Engineer
jobs.content:
At Auth0 we care about shipping developer joy while providing zero-friction solutions to make identity easy and secure. If you are passionate about creating amazing user experiences and crafting sustainable components, we are looking for you!


We believe quality software is best built iteratively, with end-to-end ownership of projects, focus on user needs, and right tools. At the moment, across our different projects, we use: React, Redux, Stylus, CSS Modules, Gulp, Webpack, and others, and we routinely evaluate improvements to our stack.


If you feel you want to be part of the challenge of helping developers secure their applications, we are looking for frontend engineers to join our team to work on:



  • Dashboard: Auth0’s Management UI to integrate, secure, and configure your applications

  • Lock: Auth0’s web widget to allow drop-in authentication to any web application.


Responsibilities



  • Collaborate with fellow team members on prioritization, specifications, and progress

  • Create secure, performant, cross-platform browser applications and widgets

  • Evaluate new technologies & techniques to improve overall practices

  • Craft well-documented, reusable, and testable code

jobs.title: Junior Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Role Summary:


Our multi-award winning SMS marketing platform is trusted by brands including Volkswagen, Surfers Against Sewage and Uber; and our API allows our customers to integrate SMS with Eventbrite, Zendesk and Zapier as well as many others, allowing customers to add their own integrations.


We are looking for someone who will be involved in the development of all aspects of our powerful web application, including automating the provision of our infrastructure, designing database models, building APIs and server code (primarily in PHP), as well as writing front-end HTML, CSS and JavaScript.


The role offers excellent opportunities for growth, so our ideal candidate will always be seeking to improve their knowledge and skills, and we’ll support that by sending you to conferences and providing access to relevant training.  We are a distributed agile team operating on 2-week sprints with a strong focus on testing, so the ideal candidate has great communication skills and takes ownership of code and development. 


You will report directly to FireText’s Chief Technology Officer and company directors and we are happy for you to be based at either of our offices, Reigate, Surrey or Penryn, Cornwall; remote working (UK based) may be considered for the right candidate too.


The role will involve some travel to our office locations.


If you're a graduate or an engineer with web development experience looking to further your skills, apply now!


Example Duties: 



  • Development of new features, and maintenance of existing applications

  • Work with the team to design, program, and deliver software solutions using a variety of technologies and programming languages

  • Troubleshoot and fix operational issues as they arise

  • Continuous improvement of the systems and codebase

  • Ad-hoc internal support of operations
